results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

results.description:
While indoor and outdoor gardeners are often quite familiar with plants from all over the world, their knowledge of the botanical treasures from our own Northeast can be deficient. But knowledge of and gardening with native plants is becoming very popular not least because it turns a simple walk in the woods into a revelation as well as advancing the cause of threatened wildlife by supplying them with food. A recent column in the Times (http://www.nytimes.com/…/in-your-garden-choose-plants-that-…) illustrates the vast difference that choosing to use native plants in your garden can make. Uli Lorimer, curator of the hundred-year-old Native Garden and its new Pine Barrens and meadow extension at the BBG, will take us through his domain, revealing, through talk and photos, the year-round story of the region in which we live. 


Sponsored by the Indoor Gardening Society of New York


About the Indoor Gardening Society...

IGS is a great way to introduce adults and children to the importance of green plants. The more you know about botany and growing things, the more you understand their impact on every aspect of your life and their importance to human survival. Plants are determining factors in many aspects of human history and development. Plants will beautify your home, heighten your appreciation of the outdoors and bring it inside for you to enjoy year-round. At each of our monthly meetings members enjoy:

-a lecture or program about a horticulture-related topic

-a plant sale making rare and unusual plants available at reasonable prices

-an exhibition of spectacular specimens often unknown to people outside the plant hobbyist world and often unseen at botanical gardens.

-access to supplies and information that can turn anyone from a novice to a successful grower

Try us out at any meeting for free! Monthly (except July and August) meeting details available here and on Facebook about the third week of each month.

Become a member of IGS and receive a free plant on the spot!

-$25 yearly membership includes your entire family

More info at the Facebook page of the Indoor Gardening Society of New York or call[masked] or email [masked]. We look forward to seeing you!
results.how_to_find_us: See reception desk for room number
results.name: Old and New Native Environments at the BBG with Uli Lorimer

Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

results.description:
Wearables have arrived. With their arrival also comes a slew of design challenges. One company that has succeeded in tackling these design challenges is Wunderlist. Wunderlist (wunderlist.com) has been redesigned and rebuilt into a native application on all devices. Including the Apple Watch and Android Wear.

Come to the first #DesignDays event of the semester and learn about designing a cross platform product and dealing with the constraints and paradigms of multiple devices and systems.

We have all understood how to design for iPhones, Android, desktop computers, the web and tablets for a long time — but with the introduction of a new, and incredibly unique, device, you have to reconsider every single design choice you’ve made.
results.name: Design for Wearables

results.description:
We're very excited for the 4th New Relic User Group in New York City! Join us for an evening of presentations, collaboration, and Q&A amongst other New Relic users and experts. Food and beverages will be provided.

We are being hosted by the gracious folks at Stack Overflow.

Co-founded by Joel Spolsky and Jeff Atwood, Stack Overflow is the trusted destination for developers to find, ask, and answer programming questions. With nearly 30 million monthly visitors, it’s the world’s largest programming community. Through their hiring platform, Stack Overflow Careers lets employers reach, attract, and engage talent while helping developers find jobs they love.

Check out the schedule & speakers below and RSVP now! Hope to see you there.

Please RSVP on Eventbrite

Schedule 

6:00 - 6:30 Food, Drinks, & Networking

6:30 - 6:50 Mike Reust of Betterment

6:50 - 7:00 Break

7:00 - 7:20 Mo Hossain of New Relic

7:20 - 7:30 Break

7:30 - 7:50 Tori Wieldt, New Relic - From Pets to Cattle to Bacteria

7:50 - 8:30 Q&A, Discussion

All New Relic users and fans are welcome! For more New Relic events in New York City, be sure to check out our page on Meetup and keep an eye on the hashtag #NRUG.

Please RSVP on Eventbrite



Talk Details

Mike Reust, Engineering Manager, Betterment

Painless Migration

Keeping an eye on our systems while we moved from four static serves in Rackspace to hundreds of ephemeral servers in AWS, without losing our minds or disappointing our users.

Mo Hossain, Enterprise Sales Engineer, New Relic

Synthetics is your minion 

Learn to use New Relic Synthetics in your testing and production environments to ensure critical processes on your site are available 24x7. Want to use NR Synthetics to monitor your internal sites? Want to learn how to monitor specific assets of your site over a period of time? Come find out how! 

Tori Wieldt, Developer Advocate, New Relic


From Pets to Cattle to Bacteria 

We see a move of servers move from virtualization (cattle) to process separators (bacteria). What will the impact be to have servers that last only last as long a single process? At New Relic, we have customers monitoring Docker containers that last 5 minutes or less. How can organizations plan, develop and operate software in this environment? I’ll provide insights we gathered from our customers and from our own internal use of containers and short-lived servers.

FAQs



What is the closest subway stop to the venue?

Closest transit station is the Fulton Street subway station, which reaches subway lines 2, 3, 4, 5, A, C, J, and Z lines.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

If you have any questions, please contact [masked].

Please RSVP on Eventbrite
results.name: 4th NYC New Relic User Group

results.description:
Join StoryForward NYC as we talk to a panel of leading storytellers about how they build communities for their narratives. Andrea Phillips (A Creator’s Guide to Transmedia Storytelling), John Trigonis (Crowdfunding for Filmmakers) and Katrina German (One-Story), will discuss how they grow and maintain their audiences. We’ll talk crowdfunding, interactive experiences and much, much more.

Andrea Phillips is an award-winning transmedia writer, game designer and author. She has worked on projects such as iOS fitness games Zombies, Run! and The Walk, The Maester's Path for HBO's Game of Thrones, human rights game America 2049, and the independent commercial ARG Perplex City. Her projects have variously won the Prix Jeunesse Interactivity Prize, a Broadband Digital award, a Canadian Screen Award, a BIMA, the Origins Vanguard Innovation Award, and others. Her book A Creator's Guide to Transmedia Storytelling is used to teach digital storytelling at universities around the world. Her independent work includes the Kickstarted serial  The Daring Adventures of Captain Lucy Smokeheart and The McKinnon Account, a short story that unfolds in your email inbox.  Her debut novel Revision is published by Fireside Fiction Co. and her short fiction has been published in Escape Pod, Fireside Magazine, and the Jews vs. Aliens anthology. 

Follow Andrea on Twitter: @andrhia

A behind-the-scenes consulting machine, John T. Trigonis has mentored hundreds of filmmakers and other content creators worldwide to create compelling crowdfunding experiences that not only reach, but often exceed their goals. An indie filmmaker and successful crowdfunder himself, Trigonis has literally written the book on Crowdfunding for Filmmakers, (and is currently rewriting it as a second edition) and after spending a few years as a private consultant, he puts his prowess to its ultimate use as Indiegogo’s head Film Campaign Strategist. 

Follow John on Twitter: @Trigonis

Katrina German is the CEO and cofounder of OneStory.com, an easy way to create and share video interviews. Katrina is passionate about bridging storytelling and technology and the resulting company OneStory.com has collected video interviews from nineteen different countries. Katrina is an award-winning social entrepreneur and a former social media strategist who regularly runs campaigns that reach millions of people.

Follow Katrina on Twitter: @Katrinavision 

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.
results.name: SEMINAR: The Art of Community Building For Storytellers

results.description:
This is a great class for beginner Spanish speakers. The cost is only $175 for the entire semester! Please email or send a message to confirm that we are still accepting new students.

Level 1 is an introduction to the Spanish language. Students will learn to form and answer simple questions and hold simple conversations on topics such as family, home, food, health and employment. Through interactive dialogues, games and songs, the structure of simple sentences in the present tense will be practiced.

El Nivel 1 de español es una introducción al lenguaje.  Los estudiantes aprenderán a formar y contestar preguntas sencillas y a mantener conversaciones sencillas sobre temas como la familia, el hogar, la alimentación, la salud y el empleo.  A través de diálogos interactivos, juegos y cantos, se practicará la estructura de oraciones sencillas en el tiempo verbal presente.
results.name: Spanish 1 - Basic conversational Spanish

group.name: El Centro, volunteer led language classes in Midtown

results.description:
Only $75 for the entire semester! The whole semester for only $50. Please email to confirm that we are still accepting new students before coming to this class.

English 1 is a basic introduction to the language. Students will learn to ask and answer simple questions and carry on simple conversations on topics such as family, home, food, health and jobs. Through interactive dialogues, games and chants, they will practice simple sentence structure using present verb tenses. 

Inglés Nivel 1 es una introducción. Los estudiantes aprenderán a formar y contestar preguntas sencillas y mantener conversaciones sencillas sobre temas como la familia, el hogar, la alimentación, la salud y el empleo. A través de diálogos interactivos, juegos y cantos, se practicará la estructura de oraciones sencillas en el tiempo verbal presente.

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly/Scrabble/Risk/etc. Be adventurous and come learn some new games that will change the way you think about board games!

We begin gathering around 6pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be around the corner from the bar!

results.description:
All too often inventors are so fixated on their invention and not on the resources that can help them take it further.  We all have done this and sometimes loose track of the people around us and the power of networking.

Ellen Volpe will help us better understand the "adjacent possible" and the hidden opportunities in our business and social circles.  As a master of building strategic networks and facilitating business groups, Ellen will share the secrets of building valuable relationships, trust and rapport...whether it be with potential business collaborators, investors or customers.

Ellen Volpe has been President of ABA since 1988.  ABA is the longest-running professionally managed business-to-business networking organization in New York.  She is dedicated to teaching businesses and individuals how to build their networks and create unexpected opportunities.

We look forward to seeing you there for this very informative meeting!
results.name: Invention Success in Your Hidden Assets-The Power of Networking & Social Capital

results.description:
6:30PM - 7:00PM - Networking

7:00PM - 8:00PM - Is NUI the Next Breakthrough in UI Biometrics/Personal­ization/Identificat­ion?

Personalization of products, services, even functionality of everyday devices is the next frontier in UI development. The ability to quickly and secure verify an identity of a user is a key in the process. Making user authentication a friendly, or even better, a frictionless process to a user, is key to adaptation.


Traditional passwords are on the way out. Biometrics will become the next identification standard. In this presentation President of Speechpro Alexey Khitrov will make a case for voice and multi-modal verification on mobile platforms and voice-based UI's. Speechpro pioneered this approach with its deployment at Wells Fargo where voice+face biometrics replaced traditional passwords and PINs in the bank's mobile app.


Mr Khitrov will share insights from this deployments and present new ideas and biometric capabilities for user authentication.

Alexey Khitrov is a President of SpeechPro, a global leader in voice biometrics. He joined the company in 2007 as Director of Strategic Development and helped SpeechPro to actively grow in the biometric space. Mr. Khitrov is an active member of the biometric community and as a thought leader, is frequently invited to address industry trade shows and conferences.

Prior to joining SpeechPro, Alexey spent over 3 years at BMO Capital Markets working with a variety of financial products. He holds an MBA degree from Schulich School of Business (York University, Toronto, Canada). Before his MBA studies, he gained over 5 years of experience with a number of leading financial institutions. 

8:00PM - 8:30PM - Hang Out - Network

Share this event:  http://bit.ly/NUICen_NY29 @nuicen

Join NUI Central.com

IMPORTANT : If you come to the event and you are not registered on the Meetup site by 3:00PM on the day of the Meetup, you will have to wait to the side to see if there's room to accommodate you. If so, you will have to pay $8 to be admitted, else you will have to leave.

CODE OF CONDUCT

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
results.name: Is NUI the Next Breakthrough in UI Biometrics/Personalization/Identification?

results.description:
WHAT

During the demo, I am going to create and deploy a full MEAN stack site to Heroku at "live" pace - almost as fast as I would do it for an actual project. Along the way, I will explain the concepts and reasoning behind each step. This is not intended to be followed by participants on their computers. The pace will be too fast for beginners and the idea is to show what can be accomplished quickly with the right tools and skills. Those topics are thoroughly covered in the weekend and 8-week paid workshops.

WHO

This demo would be helpful for anyone who wants to learn software development but needs a better understanding of how the various pieces connect. If you can create a web site using a popular framework like Rails and deploy it on Amazaon, Digital Ocean, etc, this is probably too easy for you.

Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 90 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program.

results.description:
Events are intended for people who identify as women, which includes trans women. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc.

What is this group? Who is this event for? This is a weekly study group for intermediate and advanced women in tech (women looking to start building a project or learn a framework, industry women looking for other fabulous engineers!) . We meet every Monday and provide you with the space to continue your project, present problems you can work on with other attendees.

If you are an intermediate or advanced member and would like either demo a project or try teaching, please reach out to [masked]!


Optional Eloquent Javascript Study Group Karuna and Alisha will lead tonight's optional weekly study group, which follows the chapters of Eloquent Javascript. Tonight we will discuss and review the exercises in Chapter 3. The link for the book is http://eloquentjavascript.net/. If you would like to participate, check out those chapters before hand and try out the problems at the end of the chapter.

Materials? Please bring a laptop! 

Schedule: 

6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code 
7:05 Welcome from our host and demos 
7:20 Meetup starts 
9:00/9:30 Meetup ends

A valid photo ID will be required to enter the building. Please be sure to enter your full name when RSVPing for this event. 

Why is this event closed? RSVPs open 2 weeks in advance to ensure a higher attendance rate. So if the event is on October 15, you can start registering for it October 1.
results.name: Front-End Dev Study Group @ DigitalOcean

results.description:
In Lean and Agile design, we’re always testing. But even with quick feedback loops, research findings can be difficult to sort through. The standard affinity mapping exercise doesn’t always give us a clear picture of what to do next – identifying patterns is only half the battle.

In this workshop, you’ll have a chance to try out an approach to research synthesis that will keep your tests focused and help your team prioritize your next steps. We'll break into small teams to run a quick user research session, share findings, align on problems observed, and determine our next steps. 

Presenters

</a><a href="http://twitter.com/pawlsullivan">Paul Sullivan & Linda Joy, product designers at Pivotal Labs.

Agenda

6:30 to 7:00pm - Space opens, Meet & Greet.

7:00 - 8:30 - Presentation, Workshop and Discussion.
results.how_to_find_us: We're on the 2nd floor
results.name: Agile UX Workshop: Feedback to Features

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: GOING FORWARD WE ARE STARTING AT 6:30 PM INSTEAD OF 7:00 PM.


WSSL members, come beat the unseasonable heat at WSSL's September .22 Rifle Shoot! Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of experience with guns but don't know where to shoot in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible shooting skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on September 21st. 


If you want to shoot with WSSL this September and you've never joined us before, please read the entire event description and start your registration ASAP! 


Feel free to bring friends! (Remind them to register in advance!) All levels are welcome (never shot, beginners, intermediate, advanced). We will have some fun shooting drills, too! This meetup is limited to women, but we do have  co-ed shoots sporadically throughout the year, so keep posted!

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.
results.how_to_find_us: The range is downstairs. Just walk right in and ask for WSSL! See you there!
results.name: September .22 Rifle Shoot at Westside Range

results.description:
Angular is GREAT for building client-side applications for the Web. But since Angular code is developed using JavaScript, Angular has all of the issues that come with coding in JavaScript: no strong data typing, global namespace issues, and lack of class-based object-oriented programming techniques. TypeScript solves these issues *and* makes it easier to build, refactor, and maintain your Angular applications! This course focuses on the basics of building an Angular application with TypeScript.

About the Author: Deborah Kurata is an independent consultant with over 15 years of experience in designing and developing successful Microsoft .NET applications as well as mentoring software developers. Her focus is on iterative design and development, and automated unit testing. Deborah has authored several books, including the "Doing Objects" series (Addison-Wesley), "Best Kept Secrets in .NET" (Apress) and "Doing Web Development: Client-Side Techniques" (Apress). Deborah speaks at conferences such as VSLive and TechEd. For her work in support of software development and software developers, she has been recognized with the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) award.
results.name: Angular with TypeScript (1 of 3)

results.description:
We all have unlimited potential to grow our businesses. We sign up for coaching and learn strategies to increase our sales, but selling is still the hardest part for most of us. Why is that? – Because a confident mindset and a compelling presence are critical to create sustainable results. We all have it in us, but how do we bring our enormous potential to bloom? How can we reframe our mind and transform our energy so they support our sales goals and our success?

Regina Huber will share some amazing tools and mindful inspiration that can help you create the sales you want!
results.name: Boost Your Sales With Inner Power & Outer Presence

results.description:
"To find real power and achievement, you must push beyond your fears to discover your true potential."  - Dr. David Bach. 

Join us on Monday, Sept. 21st with Dr. David Bach, Founder and Chairman of the Platypus Institute, Harvard-trained scientist, physician and serial entrepreneur. 

During this fascinating presentation you will learn:

• Real and tangible tools to help you achieve peak performance and efficiency in brain power

• Tools to enhance effectiveness and life-experience

• A better knowledge of how to create powerful change in your life with tangible results

• A strong understanding of how peak performance applies to your entrepreneurial journey and can help you grow and reach your business goals

**** Attendance is Free, however you also MUST RSVP through this link for access: http://ga.co/1LqDcAy 

SPACE IS LIMITED! Grab your ticket now and learn how to thrive in business and in life.

There will be networking before and after the presentation.

Prior to founding the Platypus Institute, Dr. Bach started and built three $100 million healthcare service companies. He has also been a venture capitalist (with TA Associates), a competitive martial artist and a professional musician. Dr. David Bach is focused on helping others unlock their potential. He truly believes everyone has the capacity for greatness, and he works to help everyone achieve peak performance through rewiring both brain and body.Scientists have studied “peak performance” for over 60 years, but during the past few years, knowledge in this area has exploded! What used to be science fiction is now reality. Technology exists today that measurably increases your IQ, optimizes your sleep, expands your energy capacity, increases longevity, improves memory, and – most dramatically – enables you to consistently operate in a pure peak performance state.


In Partnership With:
results.name: Discover the Secrets to Optimal Performance with Dr. David Bach

results.description:
Join us for an advance screening of THE INTERN Red Carpet Premiere 

For free ticket information and entry PLEASE READ IN FULL THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW.

SYNOPSIS: 

Academy Award winners Robert De Niro ("Raging Bull," "Silver Linings Playbook") and Anne Hathaway ("Les Misérables," "The Devil Wears Prada") star together in Warner Bros. Pictures' "The Intern." Oscar-nominated and award-winning filmmaker Nancy Meyers ("It's Complicated," "Something's Gotta Give," "Private Benjamin") is directing the comedy from her own screenplay. In The Intern, De Niro stars as Ben Whittaker, a 70-year-old widower who has discovered that retirement isn’t all it’s cracked up to be. Seizing an opportunity to get back in the game, he becomes a senior intern at an online fashion site, founded and run by Jules Ostin. The film’s multi-generational cast also features Rene Russo, Anders Holm, Andrew Rannells, Adam Devine, Celia Weston, Nat Wolff, Linda Lavin, Zack Pearlman, newcomer Jason Orley, and Christina Scherer.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZU3Xban0Y6A

Come out and enjoy a movie on us!

FOLLOW THESE INSTRUCTIONS FOR YOUR FREE PASSES

★Click on the link below.

★Sign up 

★If tickets are still available, you will receive an email confirmation. PRINT OUT YOUR TICKET CONFIRMATION - That means the confirmation you get from the movie ticketing site. (In the past some of our members mistakenly brought the MeetUp confirmation instead). Don’t think you can show it on your phone, you must print it out. 

"bring with them the printed pass that they download from WB Tickets (link below, while supplies last). Talent will be in attendance and all pertinent details (dress code, arrival, etc.) will be on the ticket under SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS." 

★Let us know in the Comment section below if when you receive a confirmation email. (Also, feel free to ask questions if you are encountering obstacles.)

  ♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦ Important, please keep reading ♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

Suggested arrival time is between 6-630. You will need to get in line with all other people trying to get into the free movie. The movie begins at 7. This is first come, first serve. If you show up too late, you may not get in. You also want to come early if you come with someone to make sure that you can sit together.

DO NOT SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO ATTEND OR YOU THINK SOMETHING WILL COME UP. The promo company receives the names of all who sign up and can see who does not use their ticket. Your no-show can affect future free movie offers and we don’t want to mess that up!

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

⍟ MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL ADDRESS FOR UPDATES.  

⍟ RSVPing here on MeetUp alone does not get you a movie pass. Follow the above instructions for your tickets. 

⍟ Security will require ID. 

⍟ AGAIN, MAKE SURE WE HAVE YOUR NAME AND EMAIL FOR UPDATES! 

Ticket link: </a><a href="http://www.wbtickets.com/Lzyjl78835">http://www.wbtickets.com/Lzyjl78835

results.description:
Fullstack's JavaScript Jumpstart is a two week night course that teaches the "ABC's" of Programming and JavaScript.

WHO IS THIS COURSE FOR? 

It's designed for students with some small experience programming who want to get a "jumpstart" on their journey toward becoming a Fullstack developer. This course is also a great way to prepare for Fullstack Academy's admissions interviews. 

HOW IS THE COURSE STRUCTURED? WHAT IS THE SCHEDULE? 

The course will run over 3 evenings in September. The three sessions will cover JavaScript fundamentals. Each concept will be covered by a practical hands-on workshop. You'll develop core programming skills and use them to build a cool final project, which will be done remotely after the 3rd class.  There will also be remote work to be completed during a portion of the off-nights.

IS JAVASCRIPT JUMPSTART AN IN-PERSON OR REMOTE CLASS?

Both! There are two options for attending this course:

Live/In-Person - Jumpstart is taught at Fullstack Academy's campus in downtown NYC. Choose this option to attend all 3 evenings in-person, get in-person instruction and TA assistance, and see the Fullstack campus.

Remote/Online - If you can't make it to the Fullstack campus, you can also attend JavaScript Jumpstart remotely. All lectures will be video-streamed, and workshop assistance will be available for remote students.

HOW MUCH DOES THE COURSE COST?

Tuition for this course is $295

HOW CAN I REGISTER? 

You must register through Eventbrite to secure a spot in the class. Head to the link below to signup for the class. Exclusively for our Meetup group members - Use the coupon code "jsmeetup" to take 15% off the price!

**EVENT SIGNUP LINK:https://september-javascript-jumpstart.eventbrite.com**


** More Info: JSJ Class Details ** 

Class space is limited, sign up today to secure your spot!

Course Schedule: 6:30pm - 9pm All Evenings

Day 1: Monday, September 21st, 2015

Day 2: Wednesday, September 23rd, 2015

Day 3: Monday, September 28th, 2015
results.name: JavaScript Jumpstart September 2015

results.description:
New York City DSA is holding a membership meeting. The meeting will discuss DSA's National Convention, to be held November 13, 14 and 15 near Pittsburgh, PA, and elect delegates to the convention. Maria Svart, DSA's National Director, will report on planning for the convention and DSA's ongoing strategy discussion.

The meeting will also discuss our work for Bernie Sanders. Also, it will feature a special short preview of a new production by NYC DSA’s Paul Bedard and his theater company, Theater in Asylum, who are teaming up to create live theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Presidential debates. There might be multiple Hillarys, a female Bernie, a Greek chorus of "questions from Facebook" -- anything to illustrate and illuminate the candidates.

Anyone is welcome to attend but only paid-up DSA members may vote in the election or serve as delegates to the convention.
results.name: NYC-DSA Membership Meeting

Join us for an evening of Qigong and unwind the daily stress and tension, clear your mind, and rejuvenate your body.

On Monday evenings, we explore the nature of Qi and Elixir Light Qigong through engaging exercises, mindful breath-work, meditation, and gentle movement patterns. Elixir Light Qigong draws on ancient Buddhist and Taoist practices to help practitioners develop their body, mind, and spirit.


Also, in an ongoing effort to accommodate your feedback when planning our future Qigong classes and events, please fill out this brief survey – simply follow the link below. Each of your votes adds up so make sure we make yours count too!

-Dan

results.description:
WHAT: Top rope climbing & bouldering at an indoor gym 

WHEN: Every Monday, 6:30pm (Gym open until 10pm so you can come later but then you might not get buy-one-get-one discount).

WHERE: Gravity Vault

WHO: Anyone with prior climbing experience (any skill level is acceptable, but must have climbed indoors previously at least once). If you've never climbed but always wanted to try it, check out their belay certification class on Fridays.

HOW MUCH: Mondays are 2 for 1 deal, but both people have to be present to take advantage of the discount. If we do not have an even number of attendees, odd person out would have to pay full price. Passes are normally $18, or $9 each with discount, and $7 for all the equipment rentals if you don't have them already.

*** Event repeats every Monday ***

results.description:
These Psychic Development and Spirit contact classes are created for people who are passionate committed and sincere about developing their Intuition, Psychic abilities and contact with Spirit.

If you have always believed you are psychic, or have seen and felt Spirit during your life, or you feel compelled to explore this part of yourself- you will love this class. Please bring an open Spirit, curiosity, enthusiasm and a belief in the possibility of many Univeses, star systems and Spirit beings and ancestors..

In this class you will Experience:

. Meditation 

. Developing Your Clairvoyance, Clairsentience, , Clairaudience, Clairscent, and Clairgustance.

. Work with Spirit Guides, Gate Keepers, Spirit Teams as well as ancestors and loved ones in Spirit.

. Explore Your Dreams for their deep , ancient and powerful symbols that connect you to the Spirit universe.

. Psychometry: Reading the energy imprints of objects as a way of focusing Psychic impressions and Mediumship.

. Photograph Readings: Tuning into the life experiences of people in photos beyond physical sight,  3D emotion, impressions to connect at a deeper level.

. Psychic and Mediumship Readings for other members of the class.

Developing your Intuition accelerates your success  in all areas of your life. Some people may choose to become professional Psychics and Mediums. Others will use their gifts to enhance business, career,relationships and learning about their life path and the universe we all live in

This is created for your development and for people share a passion for this work. Psychic and Mediumship Circles are most dynamic and powerful when people come on a continuous basis. 5 sequential weeks are a required starting point to see your development take off!!!!

After the 5 Week class, you can continue on, or take a break and come back..
results.name: Explore Seen. Unseen Contact Spirits

results.description:
Want to start a startup but don’t know what resources are available to you in New York?


New York has a fast growing startup ecosystem, and entrepreneurs here are lucky to have so many resources available to help them in their journey. However, many people don't know about all of the resources available, the differences between them, or what resources are right for them.

At "How to Start Up in New York", we will gather representatives from different entrepreneurial organizations to give a quick overview of who their audience is, and then host a panel moderated by a top local journalist to discuss the startup ecosystem and the opportunities available.

Speakers include: 

- Jason Shuman (Venture Capitalist, Corigin Ventures)

- Dean Soukeras (Founder, HomeSwipe)

- Alberto Escarlate (CEO , FileChat)

- Pavel Asanov (CEO, Play Fitness)

Who should attend?
- Anyone who is launching or thinking about launching a local startup
- Anyone who wants to meet local investors, accelerators, co-working spaces, and founders
- Anyone who wants to learn about the resources available for local entrepreneurs
- No service providers please!

What is the Agenda?
- Welcome and Socializing
- Introductory Talks by Ecosystem Organizations
- Panel Discussion with Representatives from Top Local Organizations
- Question and Answer Session
- Discussion and Drinks at a Local Bar or Restaurant

This event is FREE, and we expect over 50 people in attendance. For more information, visit http://fi.co/e/58611/meetup.

Hope to see you there!

---
Also remember to sign up for our Founder Insight mailing list to receive exclusive startup training videos and articles every Monday and Thursday: http://eepurl.com/SLa
results.name: How to Start a Startup in New York

results.description:
This 2015 fantasy film stars Julianne Moore as an evil enchantress and Ben Barnes as the young man who must defeat her. The movie is based on a best-selling YA fantasy book series. Join us in the Event Room of the Glen Rock library which is in the lower level.

This film is presented by the Infinite Images group of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County on the third Monday of most months. The Association also sponsors book groups, television gatherings and other events focused on the genres of science fiction, fantasy and horror.

Visit us at www.sfabc.org or write to me at SFABCPhilmu (at) gmail.com for more information.

Note: the Licensing Agreement does not permit us to actually state the title of the movie.

The Library now requires us to state the movie's rating (PG-13) and the following requirements:

"Children under 13 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian in order to view the film. For more information about movie ratings, visit mpaa.org."

"Registration required in person or by phone (201) 670-3970."

results.description:
The Perks of Being a Wallflower by Stephen Chbosky

Read the cult-favorite coming of age story that takes a sometimes heartbreaking, often hysterical, and always honest look at high school in all its glory. Now a major motion picture starring Logan Lerman and Emma Watson, The Perks of Being a Wallflower is a funny, touching, and haunting modern classic.

The critically acclaimed debut novel from Stephen Chbosky, Perks follows observant “wallflower” Charlie as he charts a course through the strange world between adolescence and adulthood. First dates, family drama, and new friends. Sex, drugs, and The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Devastating loss, young love, and life on the fringes. Caught between trying to live his life and trying to run from it, Charlie must learn to navigate those wild and poignant roller-coaster days known as growing up.

A #1 New York Times best seller for more than a year, an American Library Association Best Book for Young Adults (2000) and Best Book for Reluctant Readers (2000), and with millions of copies in print, this novel for teen readers (or “wallflowers” of more-advanced age) will make you laugh, cry, and perhaps feel nostalgic for those moments when you, too, tiptoed onto the dance floor of life.
results.name: Let's Read The Perks of Being a Wallflower by Stephen Chbosky!

• Talk about The Craft / The Business.

To Do

• Download the SCRIPT from our "FILES" section the week before our meeting. Read it and come prepared to give your constructive commentary.

• Members who bring written reviews go first. :)

• If you sign up after the PASSWORD email blast (1 week before meeting) then email/message [masked].

• Please do not distribute passwords, scripts, or materials you obtain from RSVPing to Collective workshops.

Thanks and see you soon!

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITERS:

DAVID NEGRIN: David Negrin is a screenwriter, script doctor, producer, and professor of film and television at Hofstra University. He is Executive Director of the NYC Screenwriters Collective. He is Host of 'The Script' Podcast and moderator of @ScriptFeed.


TROY ALAN: Troy is a NYC-based comic and writer who has performed not only in the US, but recently headlined a show in Amsterdam, then went on to perform in Paris. His comedy is a mixture of intellectual sophistication and puerility. Troy is sometimes humane, other times completely insensitive, but always entertaining. Troy has worked in almost all of the New York clubs, including The Comic Strip, The Stand, Stand-Up New York, Caroline’s, New York Comedy Club, and Gotham Comedy Club. In addition, Troy is a regular on the underground comedy scene in New York City. Recently, Troy’s work was featured on Laughs on Fox TV and he was featured in Time Out New York’s Joke of the Week.

results.description:
Thank you all for your suggestions and your votes! The strong winner was The Girl on the Train by Paula Hawkins: 

Rachel takes the same commuter train every morning. Every day she rattles down the track, flashes past a stretch of cozy suburban homes, and stops at the signal that allows her to daily watch the same couple breakfasting on their deck. She’s even started to feel like she knows them. "Jess and Jason,” she calls them. Their life—as she sees it—is perfect. Not unlike the life she recently lost. And then she sees something shocking. It’s only a minute until the train moves on, but it’s enough. Now everything’s changed. Unable to keep it to herself, Rachel offers what she knows to the police, and becomes inextricably entwined in what happens next, as well as in the lives of everyone involved. Has she done more harm than good?

Please let me know if you have any questions.

results.description:
The question of whether life exists beyond Earth has fascinated humans for over two thousand years. In this talk I present some of the historical and modern ideas that have been proposed to address this question and discuss the efforts made in the past few decades to find out if we’re not alone in the universe.

Neer Asherie is a professor of physics and biology at Yeshiva University. He received a B.A. and M.A. in natural sciences (physical) from Cambridge University and a Ph.D. in physics from MIT. He has been awarded grants from the National Science Foundation to support his research on the self-assembly of globular proteins. His articles have appeared in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Physical Review Letters, and Crystal Growth and Design. In addition to his scientific publications, Neer has authored a novel and several short plays.

Suggested Donation $10
results.how_to_find_us: Room B3-104

COME CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

WRITE YOUR SCREENPLAY 

A Screenwriting Workshop With Award Winning Screenwriter Jacob Krueger

Whether you’re a young writer picking up the pen for the first time, or an old pro looking to inject new life into your writing, this exciting eight week workshop will teach you a whole new way of looking at the fundamentals, and help you integrate your artistic goals into your real world life. Jacob’s groundbreaking approach to feedback fosters a close-knit community of fellow writers, whose only goal is to support you in yours. Together, you’ll discover a new form of feedback that keeps the focus on what really matters: your story and how you want to tell it. Learn more.

About Jacob Krueger

Throughout his career, Jacob Krueger has collaborated with all kinds of writers, from Academy Award Winner Michel Legrand to Tony Award winners Alain Boublil and Claude-Michel Schonberg (Broadway’s Les Miserables).

Now, he brings his groundbreaking techniques directly to you, with unique Workshops, Master Classes, and Private Coaching designed for writers of all levels with an interest in writing.

Build the writers life you've been seeking today

"Jacob Krueger is a true collaborator, totally dedicated to the project, leaving his ego behind, but nevertheless demanding the highest standards because of his sharp dramatic sense and intuition."
--Claude Michel Schonberg / Composer, Les Miserables

MORE INFO:  http://www.writeyourscreenplay.com

56 W 22nd St, 8th Floor
New York, NY 10010

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
Let's close out summer at the oh-so-trendy Press-Lounge on top of the Ink48 Hotel in Hell's Kitchen, of which the New York TImes says,  "without question one of the city’s most attractive rooftop bars."

New York Magazine says, "Press, an outdoor space on the sixteenth floor of Ink48 in Hell’s Kitchen, offers a stunning aerie. To the east, you get pure midtown cityscape with Times Square as strobe light; to the west, there’s the unobscured Hudson River. The bigger-than-average deck has seating for 172 on stools, couches, and podlike armchairs, all encircling a twenty-foot-long reflecting pool. Get there after it opens at 5:00 p.m., order an Excelsior (tequila, lime, sugar, and oranges spiced with chili) ... and stick around for the sunset."


NewYork.com writes: "...with stunning 360 view of Manhattan and Hudson river, the Press Lounge is located just a 15 minute walk from the Theatre District and Times Square. A short walk for New Yorkers but seemingly long enough to keep the crowds at bay, making it a fantastic spot to meet friends for an evening cocktail, or impress a date or clients."


Gothamist names The Press Club one of its top NYC 10 rooftop bars: "This massive elevated drinking spot's got all the fixings for a top notch NYC rooftop bar. There's a stellar, unobstructed panoramic view of the city and the Hudson River, a "dress code" (no fitted caps, flip-flops, beachwear, tank tops, t-shirts or torn clothing allowed), trendy clientele and A POOL. You cannot swim in the pool, but you can look at it and yearn to be inside of it."


The Press Lounge is one of the 10 best cocktail lounges in New York City, according to USA Today: "stunning views aside, the bar's impressive cocktails make it a favorite among in-the-know New Yorkers looking to impress clients or dates ... it's equally suited for both occasions, but if you're looking for the former, regulars say The Press Lounge could be your lucky ticket.


With all the wonderful vegetarians and vegans who attend each of our events, every event we do is liked by our members, but our "Veg Night Out!" events are the most popular of all. People enjoy the fact they can mingle (speak with lots of different people), and they love the beautiful venues that we go to. Join us for a stellar evening of lively conversation and lovely surroundings with fellow vegetarians and vegans.


There is no cover and no minimum. But please do buy a drink or two, or as many as you like.


For our new members: this is an incredibly friendly and welcoming group. Come to our Veg Night Out! at The Press Lounge and make new friends.

Our event officially runs from 7:00pm to 9:00pm. I am sure a good number of us will be staying till 10 (or later).

Train Directions: Take C or E trains to 50th Street and 8th Avenue.

Where to meet: Go to the rooftop bar, The Press Lounge, on the 16th floor of the Ink48 Hotel . We will be by the bar area, and also outside on the terrace. Look for our large group.

See you at The Press Lounge!

Martin

Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
Creating passionate connections within sex-positive communities can be exciting and inspiring. When community expectations and rules vary from the mainstream culture, it can be hard to figure out where the lines are. If you’re trying to unpack the old rules about dating and sex, let an expert sex coach and educator help you find your way. Charlie Glickman PhD will untangle myth from fact, and offer you new tools to help you get out of your own way and navigate sexual situations with more ease and grace. You’ll learn:


• what makes some advances seem “creepy” and how to avoid that

• how the rules of engagement change when you move into sex-positive communities

• ways that boundaries can actually create more space for connection without fear

• how to recover from rejection without shutting down and move from “no” into reconnection

• an easy-to-use framework that will help you make even your boldest sexual requests more likely to be heard with an open heart…

• ...which ups your odds of hearing your partner’s resounding yes!


This popular workshop, co-created by Charlie Glickman and Alex Morgan, will help you discover what you can do to not be “that guy” and ignite passionate connection with confidence and ease.


People of all genders, sexual orientations, and relationship configurations are welcome.

$20 in advance, $25 at the door


Get tickets here!


Charlie Glickman PhD is a sexuality speaker, trainer, writer, blogger, and coach. He’s certified as a sexological bodyworker and has been working in this field for over 20 years. His areas of focus include sex & shame, sex-positivity, queer issues, masculinity & gender, communities of erotic affiliation, sexual embodiment, and many sexual & relationship practices. Charlie is also the co-author of The Ultimate Guide to Prostate Pleasure: Erotic Exploration for Men and Their Partners, the first definitive guide to everything you need to know to discover the amazing potential of the prostate. Find out more about him on his website or on Twitter and Facebook. For more info about Charlie’s sex coaching and sexological bodywork services, check out MakeSexEasy.com..

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 7:00 pm.

Please be punctual and check-in prior to 7 pm in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6-6:45 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7-10 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change, on Monday, September 21st for Managing for Impact: Building Foundational Skills for 21st Century Management (learn more about Marcos here).

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/BSCmgmtSept21

===========================================

We are all managers. Even if “manager” is not in your job title, whenever you enter into an organization you need to work with your teammates to get things accomplished. This requires you to know how to effectively manage yourself, your work, and other people.

Management is the most fundamental skill set not only to the success of any organization, but also to the success of your career. Yet, the vast majority of employees rarely have any type of formal management training to prepare them for such a vital role. To compound this problem, what it means to be a manager in the 21st century is dramatically changing with the typical boss-subordinate management style proving to be inefficient and destructive to organizational culture. Employees are also seeking greater meaning, purpose, and responsibility at work, requiring a shift in management that is no longer based on command and control but one of collaboration and a distribution of power.

In Managing for Impact: Building Foundational Skills for 21st Century Management you will begin developing the foundation from which all other management skills are built. This course will provide managers at all levels - from experienced managers to new, recent, or aspiring ones - with the fundamental mindsets and skills for unlocking human and social capital within your organization. Managing for Impact will show you how to empower employees at all levels to work productively, and communicate effectively, share ideas, make decisions, and build innovative products and services that positively impact the lives of people around the world.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/BSCmgmtSept21

===========================================


**SPACE IS LIMITED**

*Doors open at 6:45 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp*


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN

• Fully understand the purpose of management and how it is the foundation for building effective organizations

• Develop core mindsets and skills for becoming a great manager

• Understand why management is shifting in the 21st century and what you can do to adapt your management style to fit these changes

• Learn how to effectively build new communication channels with teammates as well as systems for giving and receiving feedback

• Learn 3 principles that you can begin implementing tomorrow to improve your management style and relationships at work


WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• New or recent managers looking to build a foundation for becoming a great manager and leader

• Experienced managers and executives wanting to understand workforce trends and how management is changing in the 21st century

• Aspiring managers looking to better understand how to get work done through collaborating with others

• Entrepreneurs wanting to learn foundational skills for managing people and building a positive work culture


INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/a2zd0ebdmzH4CONWpIiTyKuVUndmw3VL-3Wd73Fv-ixZlDhQH60b-TSCNdqMZQOHwQX1OTiB25OcX8LF3lwtQPqz-aes9kZH803RK-A7wFOIz0dhH2ypaqNqjqWX5rYGSFPnRf5U

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.  


SPACE PARTNER

results.description:
The #1 topic request we’ve gotten lately from Product Secrets members is GROWTH: that illusive beast which is the only metric that matters when you're trying to determine whether or not your product is working. Mike and Maya (the two people who run this meetup) both just started brand new companies, so this is something we’re thinking a lot about too.

Happily, we were lucky enough to meet Maud Pasturaud, who is currently VP of Growth at Spring (and formerly Head of Growth at Secret and Head of Mobile Growth at Gilt Groupe). Unlike most “growth hackers”, Maud subscribes to the growth method we agree is best for users in the long run: listen to what people want, build an awesome product, get it in front of the right audience, and growth will come.

Join us on Monday, September 21st for an introduction from Maud on growth: what it means, how it works, how to get started, and how you can make the biggest impact for your company.
results.name: PS #12: Growth, featuring Maud Pasturaud (VP of Growth at Spring)

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation


3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work


- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified


(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Monday, September 21st from 7PM to 9PM for Transformative Storytelling - Using Narrative to Communicate, Inspire, and Activate Your Community with Lee-Sean Huang, Cofounder and Creative Director of Foossa.

=========================================== 

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: bit.ly/TransformStoriesSept21

===========================================

Storytelling is more than a marketing tool. It’s a management tool.

In this class, we uncover the narrative structures and strategies used by social change practitioners and entrepreneurs for building community and inspiring action. This is a workshop for makers and social entrepreneurs who want to strengthen their skills in storytelling to transform themselves, their teams, and their broader communities.  Storytelling is a powerful tool for building a shared identity, for facilitating mutual understanding, and for facilitating collective action.

We will draw upon successful storytelling methodologies and strategies from the fields of social activism, marketing, and the arts. We will examine and decode examples of successful (and not so successful) storytelling. This class will get “hands on” with activities and exercises that will encourage participants to practice their new storytelling skills.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN 

• Why storytelling is important for social change

• What are the essential elements and structures of a good story

• How to find and craft compelling stories

• How to adapt and refine your storytelling

• What are some of the possible applications of storytelling

• How to integrate one’s personal and professional stories

• How to use stories to stand out in a crowd

• How to imbue stories with values and emotion

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR  

• Professionals, entrepreneurs, creatives, and communications strategists/marketers ready to focus on company and brand storytelling

• Professionals who have an idea for a project, organization or business that will drive change

• Professionals who already use storytelling in their work looking to find ways to systematize and refine their approach

• Professionals curious about how storytelling can enrich their work.

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Lee-Sean Huang (@LeeSean) is the cofounder and creative director of Foossa. As a community-centered designer and social innovation strategist, he has devoted his career to fostering creative civic participation and building movements for the common good.

He was previously the founding member of the design practice at Purpose, creative director of Meu Rio and a co-founder of Hepnova Multimedia. He has worked on five continents and has collaborated with organizations including the United Nations, Human Rights Watch, the SEIU, the Dalai Lama Center, the Brazil Foundation, the Packard Foundation, the Grammy Foundation, the Kigali Genocide Memorial, the Guggenheim Museum, and the Tenement Museum.

Lee-Sean is a faculty member at the School of Visual Arts MFA Design for Social Innovation and has previously lectured and taught at the New School, New York University, Cornell Tech, the College of Staten Island, the University of California Los Angeles, and the University of Hawai’i. You can learn about his current work here and more about his background here.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm
12 – 1 pm before monthly Miracles in Manhattan lectures (usually 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

You can also receive healing at the weekly Inner Vision Workouts:

Thursday's 7 – 8:30 pm

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting

Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS:

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.

results.description:
Square Dancing is easy to learn, great exercise, inexpensive and fun! 


No square dance experience necessary. Just walk to the music following the “Caller’s” patter. Contemporary square dancing might surprise you, especially since they use many different music genres.

A partner is helpful, but not required. (Remember it’s a Meetup…never hesitate to come alone.)

Wear comfortable casual clothing and soft-soled shoes.

This event is FREE and we will be joining non-meetup members at this open house.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ PLEASE READ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
SPOTS ARE LIMITED.  
ONLY RSVP YES IF YOU ARE COMMITTED TO ATTENDING.
RESERVING A SPOT FOR YOU MEANS SOMEONE ELSE CANNOT ATTEND.
IF YOU RSVP NO, THERE IS NO NEED TO POST A REASON THIS PAGE,
WE'LL JUST CATCH YOU NEXT TIME. 
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~


FAQ

Do I need a partner?
No, but having a partner is helpful.

Is it strenuous?
A typical dance is two hours and you may average three to 5 miles of walking while exercising your mind and having FUN.

Do I need to dress up?
Attire at these dances will be casual, just be sure to wear soft-soled shoes.

Isn't square dancing kind of "square"?
Are you thinking square dancing is what you did in grade school, something easy which you memorized and which became boring? Things have changed. Not only do modern square dance callers change the figures you dance, they also use a wide variety of music.

Do you think I can do this?
If you can walk to music you can learn to square dance. To see the action you can visit <a>www.you2candance.com.</a>

Will I meet new people?

Square dancing is a "team sport" done in ever changing groups of 8 people. Undoubtedly you will meet new friends.

results.description:
On the third Monday of each month the Rahway River Trout Unlimited Chapter holds its monthly general meeting at the Cranford Community Center at 7:30. Following the agenda we usually have a guest speaker perform a presentation. Join us this month as we welcome Nicole Seymour
Nicole  has been fishing since around age 3, but only in the last few years has immersed herself with fly fishing and fly tying. When she isn't fishing for bass out of her boat, she's primarily swinging wet flies and soft hackles for trout. When not near the water, she can be found behind a vise filling up her boxes, reading or using her artistic talent to create charcoal drawings and paintings that represent her passion for angling. An active member of the Catskill Fly Tyers Guild, Nicole also volunteers with Project Healing Waters and recently created a youth coloring & activity book for the Catskill Fly Fishing Center and Museum.
results.name: General Meeting /  Nicole Seymour Up & Coming Catskill Fly Tyer

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 3 and 4: "The Nature of Intelligence" & "Inheriting our food choices"

• Chapter 3: The Nature of Intelligence; 

“It should not be believed that all beings exist for the sake of the existence of man. On the contrary, all the other beings too have been intended for their own sakes and not for the sake of anything else.” —Maimonides. Despite all the efforts of theology, science and art, do we really know ourselves better now than a 1000 years ago? Who knows what e really are. As such, how could we possibly know what it is to be an eagle, a dolphin, a lion, a stallion, pig, bull or chicken. Who are we to dis-regard their importance, and the value they place on their own lives?

• Chapter 4: Inheriting our food choices "

“This is dreadful! Not only the suffering and death of the animals, but that man suppresses in himself, unnecessarily, the highest spiritual capac- ity—that of sympathy and pity towards living creatures like himself— and by violating his own feelings becomes cruel.” —Leo Tolstoy. Who decided your tastes? was it you? Your parents? Your culture. The commercials you watch? is our diet natural, and is the food we are told is good for us really in our best interests.

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural, economic, ethical and spiritual well-being too.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, changed the way you perceive the world or the way you interact with the world, 

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor. 

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.
results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 3 & 4
