results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.

Mondays are the best days to go for large groups, which is why we picked July 13th. Please arrive on time so that we can all get lanes next to each other.

This meetup is more about spending time with friendly faces and people who have a high degree of empathy for others. If this will be your first time to our meetups, we look forward to meeting you and welcoming you into our group.    We are accepting of everyone and want to make each and every member feel like they are apart of our family. 

To our members who have been to previous meetups, we encourage you to welcome any first-timers and help them understand what we are all about. Let's not create any cliques or alienate ourselves from first-timers... we want all to feel acknowledged and welcomed.

Please be prepared to pay for yourself and for your bowling shoes. We would also like to ask that you donate $2 to help fund this group. Any contribution you can make would be much appreciated.

Most people only glimpse the incredible gratification and satiation and connection that is possible, never actually say yes to it.

But you are different. You have glimpsed it, you have tasted it, and you are ready to finally say yes to it. Or you wouldn't be reading this.

Fully Naked: How to Have Sex That Reveals Your Soul is an intimate panel of four people who have said YES to their sexual appetite, to their inappropriate desire, to their craving for mind-blowing love and relationship.

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki (lecture)
Wednesdays from 7 – 8:30 pm with Christopher Pelham (lab)
A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.


These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

results.description:
Join Irina for this creative vinyasa flow yoga class.  This is an all levels class with just the right amount of alignment cues and modifications to make it intuitive and appropriately challenging for beginners to advanced practitioners. 

The vinyasa style of yoga links the yoga poses (asanas) with the breath, focusing as much on the transitions from pose to pose, as on the actual poses.  This class starts with a mindful and centering warm-up, building into a moderately paced yoga flow and allowing for deeper stretches and longer holds toward the end of the class. By the final pose, savasana, your body and mind will feel totally prepared to melt into a blissful state of peace and relaxation.

Pricing: $10.  

Please make an effort to arrive 5 to 15 minutes in advance of class and always RSVP (even if it's last moment).  If you need to be late, please walk-in and set up as quietly as you can.  Thank you.

results.description:
Learn the differences between how men and women talk.


Do you ever wonder why you keep picking that same unavailable guy? Or why it's so hard to communicate? 

Let's take a look at flaming red flags, pink post-it notes (things to check back on) and green lights in dating. 

This call may be your game-changer. 

FREE! Invite your girlfriends since it’s a phone party!

Register here: It's required and space is limited so register now.

*Sorry guys - this seminar is for WOMEN ONLY*


About me, the instructor: 

Hi! I'm Wendy Newman, author of 121 First Dates. I'm committed to helping women find their own happily ever after -- that person who loves you just as you are. 

I'm a workshop leader, and I've led hundreds of workshops about understanding men, women, sex, dating, online dating, and relationships of all kinds to thousands of women internationally.

Over the past 10 years, I've interviewed thousands of men on sex, dating, relationships and women. Add to that extensive research, input from outside sources, and good old-fashioned trial and error, and I'd say it makes me someone who has something to say about men, women and dating.

Also, I'm a percipient and compassionate fellow dater who navigated my way through 12o first dates before I retired my lucky dating scarf for lucky first date #121. We live (in the Twitter-loin) in San Francisco, California.  (Seminar is 6pm Pacific time and 9pm Eastern Standard time)


Register Now – telephone lines are limited on the call.

http://myaccount.maestroconference.com/conference/register/3ZGDKDCVOA6F2DIF

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after ,,,, not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Don't be late , we start on time : )
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.

We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.
results.name: Partners in Business: North Jersey Referrals Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

In this live chat, we'll talk to real estate investor Joe Fairless, and learn more about how to grow your success in an ever-changing industry. We will cover a wide range of topics, from the challenges in the real estate industry to the BEST EVER real estate investing advice, to future trends that will have a meaningful impact on both investors and developers alike.

We encourage everyone to join the conversation, and share your experiences and thoughts with the crowd!

About Patch of Land

Patch of Land aims to solve the problem of slow, inefficient, fragmented and obscure private real estate lending by using the latest technology, data and process efficiency to more accurately assign risk profiles and project viability, while greatly reducing time and cost of loan underwriting for borrowers with real estate projects that are overlooked or rejected by banks and traditional lenders.

About Joe Fairless

Joe Fairless is a real estate investor, educator, and owner of Fairless Investing. He controls over $21,000,000 worth of real estate and consults with clients on how to free up their time to create cash flow and long-term wealth.

results.description:
The time has come to WRITE!

For this meetup we may have some small chit chat here and there, but our purpose is singular: to get some writing done. If you have been looking for a time and space to get busy adding words to a current project, then this meetup is for you. I will bring along my bag full of prompts if anyone wants to peruse them to get started, but, for all intents and purposes, this meetup is an opportunity to support you in whatever you need to be working on now.

We will be meeting in the events room at the Todt Hill-Westerleigh Library on Victory Blvd close to CSI. They are tables and chairs for us, so bring your notebooks, journals or laptops with you to get your work done. There are outlets in the room and the library offers free wi-fi. We are permitted to have food and beverages, but they must remain in the room (they can't be brought out to the library itself). There is also a parking lot and bus stop right outside the building for your convenience!
results.name: Weekly Write-In!

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!

***

***

***Please have a government issued form of ID with you. ***

***We will be meeting at a new location, the North Academic Center of CCNY***

This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.


This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone posses a question, so bring questions!


Some topics of discussion are:
-Install/configuration assistance/ (possibly a "getting started" guide)
-Documentation/Standards/"Best Practices"
-Current events/Conventions
-Release testing/bug reporting
-Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)


You may also find someone willing to debate VI vs Emacs (however don't expect a conclusion to it ! )


A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

(If you are working a problem , some log/debugging information will be required)


Bring a project, topic or questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects.
(Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves )

The coordinators can also provide pointers based on their experience on how to get up and running as well as documentation and other resources for new users.

results.description:
Join us for this meetup on Tuesday, September 22! Thierry Delprat from Nuxeo will be speaking on how they use Elasticsearch. Food and beverage will be provided.

Thanks to Mapzen for hosting!

Elasticsearch at Nuxeo

This talk will explain how we leverage Elasticsearch capabilities to make our Document Repository scale to the sky while still relying on standard SQL based technologies and ensuring data security and integrity. We will describe the design choices behind this hybrid Elasticsearch/PgSQL architecture and explain how the technical integration with Elasticsearch was achieved.

Thierry Delprat joined Nuxeo in 2005 as Chief Technology Officer. As CTO, he guides the architectural development of the Nuxeo Platform including the adoption of Java as the platform for innovation. Prior to joining Nuxeo, Thierry worked for over 7 years at Unilog, with progressively senior experience across different branches of the consulting company. He was also a technical architect at Cryo-Networks (infrastructure for online games), and has participated in start-up companies. Thierry graduated from the Ecole Centrale de Nantes and holds a Master of Telecommunications.

results.description:
The Hatchery opens its doors to a fast paced New York style pitch event.

Hatchery style honesty. In ways others may be too polite to share. It's what you need to hear about your startup, covering marketing, finance, technology, business, presentation, and more.

Investors:   

Presenters:  

Tobly.co

FindMine.us

Member Buzz

Develop Link.org

Accern.com

What's the point?

1. Pitching practice
2. Honest feedback about your company

How it works:

1. RSVP to attend

2. We accept pitches on a rolling basis and select five companies to pitch at each AYS event. We strongly advise that you attend an event prior to submitting your pitch

3. If you would like to pitch, send materials in advance to: [masked]
- we need PowerPoint and executive summary
- deadline is 1 week before the event
- file naming: company name (1 word), underscore, deck or summary
ex. hatchery_deck.ppt, hatchery_summary.doc
- put both documents in 1 email, do not send separately

4. We will not wait for the guests to arrive. Doors open at 6pm. The event begins  at 6:30pm and ends at 8:30pm.

5. It will be FAST!

6. There is no Q&A. We can talk after the event.

Format:
5 minute entrepreneur pitch
5 minute panel critique

The Powerpoint:
Please address all of these eleven points in your slides:
1. your team
2. what your product/service does
3. what issue/pain is it looking to solve/address
4. what is the solution
5. what is the addressable market
6. what is the competitive landscape
7. any current customer/client/pilot pipeline
8. what is the revenue stream/source
9. what are your financial projections
10. how much are you looking for in investment
11. what will you do with the money, how will it be spent

Entrepreneurs who take this seriously will absolutely benefit.

Advance tickets $10; Day of $20; At door $20

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
US Citizenship- is designed to guide permanent residents through the process of obtaining US citizenship. The course accepts students of all levels and prepares them to pass the USCIS civics, reading, and writing tests. In one semester the course can bring those already studying to proficiency, or in a few semesters prepare complete novices. The course has one prerequisite, a level 2 or above understanding of English.

Ciudadanía de los EE UU - está clase es diseñada para guiar a los residentes permanentes de los Estados Unidos a través del proceso para obtener la ciudadanía estadounidense. El curso acepta estudiantes de todos los niveles y los prepara para saber la información que se requiere en las preguntas cívicas de USCIS. Los alumnos practicaran leer y contestar las preguntas del examen de ciudadanía. Después de un un semestre en el curso, los alumnos que están activamente estudiando para el examen de ciudadanía conseguirán la capacidad de pasar el examen. Despues de un par de semestres el el curso, alumnos principiantes estaran totalmente preparados. El unico requisito del curso de ciudadanía es la capacidad de comprensión de inglés de por lo menos el segundo nivel.
results.name: US Citizenship Class/ Ciudadanía de los EE UU

Tired of the rat race? We don't blame you... But no need to worry!!! Come to our CashFlow in Jersey City and learn how to get out of the rat race while having fun.


During the CashFlow in Jersey City you will see how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the fast track where your money works for you instead of you working hard for money to pay liabilities. You will also have the opportunity to network with local successful real estate investors and learn from their strategies.


Use this game to practice real world investing with play money. Cashflow in Jersey City is an educational board game that teaches accounting, finance, and investing at the same time. It makes learning fun and is recommended for adults and children age 10 and older.

We create a perfect environment to meet new people, make friends, and learn to make smart financial decisions so you can get out of the rat race for good. This board game teaches people how to think like a successful real estate investor. It brings out your investment style and shows you why you are successful or not. It is Monopoly on Steroids.

This meet up is by invitation only, so you need to answer the questions in the RSVP for us to be able to contact you with the details of this event.

results.description:
Whether you are developing for Office 365 or SharePoint on-premises, these days you are going to need some “go-to” JavaScript libraries to enhance your solutions. No matter what project I am on, over the past few years there are a number of fantastic JavaScript libraries I have learned to use and integrate with great success. They work with Apps, content editor web parts, .NET solutions, and anywhere else you can utilize JavaScript (Even CSS!). Some of my favorites covered in this session are jQuery, SPServices, jqPlot, and DataTables.

In this session I will show how to get up and running developing with JavaScript for SharePoint in multiple ways. Then I will demo each of my “go-to” libraries as well as a few others. I will discuss real world application of these libraries based on previous clients where I have used them. I will wrap up with a nice combined demo that works great in both Office 365 and SharePoint on-premises.

About Our Speaker

Tim Ferro is a Microsoft MVP, SharePoint Architect, and Senior Software Engineer living outside Philadelphia, PA. As a professional IT consultant for the past ten years, he has been working almost exclusively with SharePoint for the past seven. Branching out, he is a technical editor for the You Don’t Know JS series of O’Reilly books, and a Microsoft Specialist for Programming in HTML5 with JavaScript and CSS3. He is a Microsoft MVP for Visual Studio ALM and a Microsoft Certified Technical Specialist in SharePoint development for both MOSS 2007 and SharePoint 2010 and also SharePoint 2010 Configuration. These days he is working with Visual Studio 2013, SharePoint 2013, and Office 365. His sessions are pulled directly from real-world experience and implemented best practices at numerous clients. A frequent presenter at SharePoint Saturdays and DC/VA user groups, he also likes to tweet, blog, and attend SharePints! 


See all Tim's information (Links to Lanyrd.com profile)
results.name: JavaScript Libraries for Office 365 Developers

group.name: The New Jersey SharePoint / Office 365 User Group

results.description:
This week I am going to see A Walk in the Woods, I will arrive at 6:30 for the 7pm showing. I  have seats D6 and D7 for my son Jeremy.  If you are coming post your seat #!


Hope to see YOU!  Love, Cassie


Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket  2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

Randy Hughes - Land Trusts Made Simple

Over 30 years ago Randy started learning how to set up and administer his own title holding Land Trusts for privacy and asset protection. Over the years, Randy has become THE national Land Trust expert in the United States.


Everyone has heard of land trusts or so called “title holding trusts” but no one knows how to work them.

Discover the 8 secrets of Land Trusts. Randy will talk about:

• Ways to deal with tenants on a different "level" (protect yourself from aggressive tenants)

• Learning how to hold property in out-of-state Trustee's name

• Setting up your own Land Trusts and saving thousands of dollars

• Avoiding state LLC and Corporation annual registration fees

• Land Trusts and Lease Options - a Better Way To Do It

• Avoiding Probate expenses (easily and quickly transfer ownership to anyone)

• Making more (and safer) profits selling the Beneficial Interest on a contract

• Combining Land Trusts with corporations, LLC's and other Trusts for Dy-no-mite Protection

Randy has been a full time real estate investor since 1969. After acquiring several properties, Randy finally realized that he should take some time to learn how to protect those properties from deadbeats and their lawyers (frivolous lawsuits).

Randy will be teaching you the many benefits to using a Land Trust to not only protect assets but make more profits out of each deal.

results.description:
What do you fab?

We are super excited to introduce a new international startup accelerator & incubator, FabFoundry right here in NYC!  Expect to learn about:

• Introductions of "Maker" movement and FabCafe

• Founding stories of "FabFoundry" and its team

• Visions and future of the industry

We are also planning to have an interactive discussion with the FabFoundry team.

If you want to learn about cross-cultural business between US-Japanese markets, discover new technology, and meet other enthusiastic technologists, please come and join us at Microsoft! (and hang out afterwards at a bar nearby)

You will need to show ID matching the name you used to RSVP. 


Agenda: 

-6:30pm  Door opens/ Networking
-7:00pm  Opening Remarks        
-7:15pm   Speakers : Nob Seki & Kristen Smith, FabFoundry
                  Group Discussion for FabFoundry Business
-8:00pm  Announcements & Open Networking

About FabFoundry
FabFoundry is a global producer of startups who are developing new platform technologies in the field of digital fabrication to to redefine how products are made and manufactured. We plan to foster the NYC startup community by providing accessibility to resources such as a digital fabrication lab, a startup accelerator program, and connections to a global network to makers, designers, investors, and business partners.

Speaker 
Nob Seki

Co-Founder & CEO, FabFoundry
Nob Seki is a serial entrepreneur and 10 year senior executive at Six Apart, a pioneer in social media making blogging a global phenomenon.


Kristen Smith

Co-Founder & COO, FabFoundry
Kristen Smith has five years of experience in the maker community including the launch of Kohl’s Design It! Fab Lab. She leads the New York Chapter of Women in Hardware, an initiative connecting female founders, engineers, investors, manufacturers, and marketers building the future of connected hardware.

A special thanks to Microsoft for providing us a space for our event!

We hope that this event will be a place where Japan & NY people can come collaborate. Looking forward to seeing you all!

Masa, Yu & Toby

results.description:
Class Tuesday night 6:30-8:30pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!

results.description:
Let's climb together at this newly opened indoor rock climbing spot - The Cliffs at LIC - the newest & largest indoor rock climbing gym in NYC area. Mention NYC Active group for receive specials for our meetups (Listed below). 


Specials for our meetup:


• First-time climbers will receive free rental gear. It must be the first visit to the facility and with scheduled meet-up.
• The $99 initiation fee is waived for month-to-month membership for meet-up members if they sign up on a meet-up day.
• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability 
• Over 30,000 square feet of climbing terrain
• Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing
• 16-foot top-out bouldering
• Professional instructors with a passion for climbing
• Separate Party Room for events + classes
• Full fitness gym
No experience necessary!
Each participant must have a waiver (to be filled out by a parent or guardian for participants under 18)!

Date/Time: Every Tuesday 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm


REGULAR PRICING Posted at Cliffs LIC Website

Day Pass // $28
College Day Pass* // $24
1-Month Pass // $140
Learn to Climb 1-Month Package // $149
10-Visit Pass // $250
Memberships // Click for details

*Full-time college student ages 18-25

RENTALS

Climbing Shoes // $6
Harness // $5
Chalk Bag // $3
Package // $12

Click Here for details on memberships.

CLIMBING 101: TOPROPE BASICS

The facility includes climbing & fitness

Location (Map)

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101 
(718) 729-ROCK (7625)

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days
Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square


If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.


If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

More info: http://lic.thecliffsclimbing.com/
results.name: Tuesday Rock Climbing at The Cliffs LIC

results.description:
About the talk:

</a>If you've been thinking about trying out Julia but haven't quite gotten around to it, this is your chance. Stefan will give a gentle introduction to the language, show off some of its more interesting features, and take requests for live coding. See how you can write simple Matlab-like code or use multiple dispatch to easily do different things for different kinds of function arguments. Learn how to define your own types and make them work seamlessly with built-ins with minimal hassle. Follow along with your own installation of Julia or use juliabox.org if you don't feel like fussing around with installing all that software.

About Stefan Karpinski:

<a href="http://karpinski.org/">Stefan is one of the co-creators of Julia, a research engineer at the NYU Center for Data Science, and a co-founder of Julia Computing, Inc. (juliacomputing.com), providing support, training and consulting for Julia.

Pizza will begin at 6:30, the talk starts at 7 and then we will head to a local bar.
results.name: Hands on Intro to Julia

results.description:
We've all heard that contributing to open source projects is an important way to build your career as a developer, but getting started can be intimidating. In this presentation, Melissa will outline the various ways you can contribute to open source projects. After talking through some tips and examples, she'll share a few ways to get started. 

Melissa is the founder of RubyThursday, a free weekly online show that gives junior Rails developers bite sized tutorials, tips and tricks to help them grow. She co-organizes the Ruby Roundtable Meetup, the longest running Ruby meetup in NYC. Along with her husband, she builds startups for non-technical entrepreneurs. Melissa is also an actor with a BA in Theater from Marymount Manhattan College. She has toured nationally and appeared in numerous plays and films. She loves sci-fi and knitting.

Light refreshments will be provided.
results.name: Contributing to Open Source - You can do it! with Melissa Wahnish

results.description:
Learn How to Get out of the Rat Race! 

Cashflow 101 is a fun way to learn the basic concepts of Real estate Investing. Your objective throughout the night will be to get out of the rat race and into the fast track! In other words you have to find a way to get out of that 9-5 that we all dislike and step into the life you always wanted to live.

How do you get out of the race race you ask?

Your total monthly passive income has to be higher than your total monthly expenses.

Cashflow 101 is an educational tool in board game format which aims to teach the players concepts of investing by having their money work for them in a risk free setting (play money) while simultaneously increasing financial literacy and stressing the imperative nature of accountability.


There are two stages to the game. In the first, "the rat race", the player aims to raise his or her character's passive income level to where it exceeds the character's expenses. The winner is determined in the second stage, "the fast track". To win, a player must get his or her character to buy their "dream" or accumulate an additional $50,000 in monthly cash flow.

In place of “score cards”, there are financial statements. The game requires the players to fill out their own financial statements so that they can see more clearly what is happening with their money. It generally shows how assets generate income and demonstrates that liabilities and 'doodads' are expenses.
results.name: NY/NJ Cash Flow game night

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't open our door from 6:30 - 7 pm while meditation is in progress. Kindly refrain from ringing our buzzer during this time.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

New Date!

We’ll be going through an installation-and-configu­ration process, click-by-click, that will set-up a browser (Firefox: Developer Edition), a development environment (XAMPP), a file transfer protocol client (FileZilla), and a content-management system (WordPress) on a personal computer (Windows 7). 

Then, we’ll set-up a production environment on a virtual private server (create a new MySQL database, assign a new MySQL user to the aforementioned database, and assign a sub-domain to the aforementioned database) and push our WordPress build from the local environment to the production environment. 


Agenda: 

6:30-6:45 Networking
6:45-7:00 Lighting Round (general questions about WP)
7:00-7:45 Presentation & Questions
7:45-8:00 Final Group Networking

Our Speaker

Kenso Trabing is the President of Bloom Website Design & Development. He is an “NYC Contributor Day Volunteer” on WordPress.org.</a>

Pizza

And if you have clients, you should definitely check out their fully white labeled offering, which will help you drive revenue while protecting your clients' sites. results.description:
An introduction to the Physical Web and unlocking exciting new ways to interact with the Web.

The Physical Web is an effort to extend the core superpower of the web - the URL - to everyday physical objects. The core premise is that you should be able to walk up to any “smart” physical object (e.g. a vending machine, a poster, a toy, a bus stop, a rental car) and interact with it without first downloading an app. The user experience of smart objects should be much like links in a web browser: i.e., just tap and use.

At its base, the Physical Web is a discovery service: a smart object broadcasts relevant URLs that any nearby device can receive.
results.name: Introduction to the Physical Web

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Mansions of the Soul by H. Spencer Lewis

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 12: Christian References, Chapter 13: The Oversoul and Cycles of Incarnations, & Chapter 14: Between Incarnations.

You can download the book free here!

About the Book

The definitive work on reincarnation and the soul, this Rosicrucian classic explains all about the soul and its cycles of reincarnation. The ideas expressed here will remove from your consciousness any fear of so-called death.

Reincarnation is one of the world's most disputed doctrine. The belief in reincarnation has had millions of intelligent, learned, and tolerant followers throughout the ages. Ringing through the minds and hearts of students, mystics, and thinkers have always been the words: "Why Are We Here?" Reincarnation has been criticized by some as conflicting with sacred literature and as being without verification. This book reveals, however, in an intelligent manner the many facts to support reincarnation.

Quotations from eminent authorities, and from Biblical and Sacred works substantiate reincarnation. It places it high above mere speculation. This book is without exaggeration the most complete, inspiring, enlightening book ever written on this subject. It is not a fiction story but a step-by-step revelation of profound mystical laws. Look at some of these thought-provoking, intriguing subjects: The Cosmic Conception; The Personality of the Soul; Does Personality Survive Transition?; Heredity and Inheritance; Karma and Personal Evolution; Religious and Biblical Viewpoints; Christian References; Between Incarnations; Souls of Animals and the "Unborn"; Recollections of the Past.

All are Welcome!
results.name: COSI - Mansions of the Soul: The Oversoul & Cycles of Incarnations

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues September 22nd for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials

– Jackie

results.description:
WUFI ORNL/PRO in-depth introduction - NYC CLIMATE WEEK EDITION! 


NYPH is teaming up with our Gold Sponsor <a>ProClima</a>/475 High Performance building supply to bring to you this Climate Week special seminar.

The WUFI workshop will be taught by an experienced Passive House Professional, Floris Keverling Buisman,Founder of 475 High Performance Building Supply and Vice President of NYPH.


WUFI® PRO allows realistic calculation of the transient coupled one-dimensionall heat and moisture transport in walls and other multi-layer building components exposed to natural weather. 

WUFI® is an acronym for Wärme Und Feuchte Instationär—which, translated, means heat and moisture transiency. WUFI® software uses the latest findings regarding vapor diffusion and moisture transport in building materials. The software has been validated by detailed comparison with measurements obtained in the laboratory and on IBP’s outdoor testing field.


Join NYPH to get a better understanding of how WUFI® Pro can be used to evaluate assemblies when designing Passive House projects!

As always, NYPH  Professional & Manufacturer members can attend for FREE.


Not yet a member? Join here and get access to all member benefits including: 


FREE Access to Events 
FREE Publicity for your Company/Organization in our Directories 
Passipedia Access 
Passive+ Magazine Online Access 
Exclusive Member Meetings/Networking Opportunities 
Discounts to Events Like the Annual NYPH Conference & Expo

results.description:
Help Kids in need and see the Highline in a totally different way with the sunset over the Hudson and if a clear night you can peer through the telescopes of the Amateur Astronomers Association and see the stars and planets!


Join this special Holy Trinity Private Tour of one of NYC's newest attractions!  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day! 


The Highline is New York’s most popular attraction! The Highline is an elevated freight train trestle that operated in NYC from the 1930’s to the 1980’s. After years of neglect The Friends of The Highline have saved the structure and transformed it into a beautiful park featuring many of the elements from its’ rich history! Your tour guide will share the history of the highline and the surrounding neighborhoods and show you amazing photo’s from before the trestle was built, while it was in operation and what it looked like while abandoned.

  We will be collecting donations that night and 100% of the proceeds will go to the Marty Lyons Foundation.  They grant wishes for terminally ill kids. 

Join us for a fun evening socializing and learning.  Following the tour the group will go out for food and drinks.

What to Wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: A camera, a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

What to Expect: 20-30 fun and friendly people from CRC and Holy Trinity parish who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city.

How do I pay?  The suggested donation is $15 and you may bring cash or a check payable to The Marty Lyons Foundation

The group will meet at The Death Avenue Cafe at[masked]th avenue at 28th street between 6:30pm-7pm.  Come closer to 6:30 if you want food or drink.  We will end at Gansevoort Street for more socializing eating and drinking.

Age restriction 21+

results.description:
Come learn about the inspiring work of Mike Robbins and Helios Design Labs. Mike has helped create a number of the most significant interactive documentary projects released over the past few years. Its recent project After the Storm, was launched with the Washington Post and Helios frequently partners with the National Film Board of Canada.  

ABOUT HELIOS DESIGN LABS:


Mike Robbins is Creative Technologist and a partner at Helios Design Labs, where he has been for the last 15 years. He oversees the interactive part of Helios' creative output. Recent and ongoing storytelling projects that he has worked on in include After the Storm with Andrew Grace, the Disaster Resilience Journal with the IFRC, the Open Orchestra with the Copenhagen Philharmonic, Highrise with Kat Cizek and the NFB, Offshore with Brenda Longfellow.

The work has collectively won a number of major awards and nominations, including a Peabody for Short History of Highrise, and has been featured in such venues as IDFA, Sheffield DocFest, smartFip@, Bristol IDocs and others, including a nomination for activism at 2014 SXSW Interactive awards.


Helios is a Toronto-based creative studio that works with filmmakers, musicians, writers, academics and other like-minded individuals on digital narrative projects.

Often interactive documentary projects are collaborative endeavors between filmmaker, technologist, designer. Each party brings to the project a language specific to their respective medium. And each can have something the other needs. A filmmaker can be looking for interactive non-linearity to give new meaning to their narrative, while the designer and technologist can be seeking out the cinematic linearity of film to give essential meaning to their aesthetic and code. The artistic success of a project is related to how deep these transactions go, and to what extent perceived barriers between film, design and code are eliminated.

Filmmaker Andrew Beck Grace and Toronto-based Helios Design Labs worked remotely for six months to produce the interactive documentary essay "After the Storm" with project financing from ITVS. Perhap we could look into the how and why of interactive, web-native nonfiction content by using “After the Storm” as a test-case for this kind of work. In essence, the session will present a tool-kit of ideas for other creators in this medium.

ABOUT MIKE ROBBINS:

Mike is Creative Technologist and a partner at Helios Design Labs, where he has been for the last 15 years. He oversees the interactive part of Helios' creative output. Recent storytelling projects that he has worked on in include Highrise with Kat Cizek and the NFB, Offshore with Brenda Longfellow, 17,000 Islands with Thomas Østbye and Edwin, World Online Orchestra with the Copenhagen Phil among others. The work has collectively won a number of major awards and nominations, including a Peabody for Short History of Highrise, and has been featured in such venues as IDFA, Sheffield DocFest, smartFip@, Bristol iDocs and others, including a nomination for activism (with Offshore) at 2014 SXSW Interactive awards. Mike studied visual Arts at York University in Toronto, and picked up his computer skill on the job at Helios.
results.name: Mike Robbins presents the work of HELIOS DESIGN LABS (including After The Storm)

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
This running group is for anyone who just wants to go for a run and make new friends. If you're looking to get into better shape or become a better runner we can help you with that. But our main focus is to enjoy the run around Central Park.

We run anywhere from 3-6 miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. We will meet at Columbus Circle behind the Gold statue (The Maine Monument)to warm up stretch and have a chance to meet everyone and coordinate the run.

The New York Running company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has changing rooms, and free bag check also has lockers but you have to bring your own lock and closes at 9pm.

We can start off as a group and run as a group if everyone wants to run at the same pace but others are more than welcome to break up into smaller groups for those of you who might want to run a little faster.

After each run we head to our local bar DJ Reynolds to grab a drink or two and get something to eat and it gives us a chance to get to know each other.

I will post what I'll be wearing and my number in the comments section the day of the run.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
For this hands-on session you'll need nothing other than your laptop, your usual setup in your favourite IDE, and as always, an open mind!

The Theme will be focusing on Object Oriented Design by developing a simple application with the special rules of Object Calisthenics, which we'll explain at the start of the session. We will use TDD, mandatorily. 

The Goal is to stretch our minds by trying out something we would probably never experiment with on our day job, and to discuss it with other passionate developers. It is impossible to finish the development in 2 hours, so the focus is not on delivery (refreshing, isn't it? :))


The Language is absolutely your choice, as we are language agnostic. It's a good idea to have an environment ready with your favorite IDE and a skeleton project in which you can run unit tests, otherwise you may have to spend your first few minutes setting up the basics.

Level: Beginner/Intermediate
results.name: Hands-on session: Object Calisthenics

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
Secret Science Club presents Primatologist and Explorer Patricia Chapple Wright.

Madagascar is a strange place. It's sometimes called the 8th continent due to its unique evolution and physical isolation. Ninety percent of its wildlife is found nowhere else, and its lemurs are Earth's most diverse group of primates. With no monkeys to compete with, Madagascar's lemurs evolved into over 100 species, from the 3.5-inch Berthe's mouse lemur (the smallest primate in the world) to the now-extinct giant sloth lemur (which weighed as much as a gorilla).

When primatologist Patricia Chapple Wright first visited Madagascar in the 1980s, she discovered the golden bamboo lemur, so called because of the golden fur on its head and belly and a habit of eating cyanide-laced bamboo shoots that would kill any other primate. At the time of her discovery, Dr. Wright learned the lemur's rain forest habitat was on the verge of being chopped down. To save the lemurs, she lobbied the Malagasy government and local villagers---as well as conservationists around the world. Her efforts led to the creation of Ranomafana National Park. It's there that Dr. Wright has conducted the bulk of her scientific research over the last three decades, studying the social and family behaviors of wild lemurs, and advocating for the preservation of Madagascar's endangered wildlife.

Winner of the MacArthur "Genius Grant" and the 2014 Indianapolis Prize for her extraordinary contributions to wildlife conservation, Dr. Wright is one of the world's foremost experts on lemurs, professor of anthropology at Stony Brook University, and founder of Centre ValBio Research Station in Madagascar. She is the author of over 150 scientific papers, as well as the books High Moon Over the Amazon: My Quest to Understand the Monkeys of the Night and For the Love of Lemurs: My Life in the Wilds of Madagascar. She has organized and led over 40 expeditions to study the world's primates. Dr. Wright and her field research have been featured on film in Michael Apted's Me and Isaac Newton and the 3-D IMAX movie, Island of Lemurs.

Before & After 
--Sample our wild and swinging cocktail of the night, the Nocturnal Prowler
--Swing by your tail to almost-human grooves
--Stick around for the eye-popping Q&A

This wild edition of the Secret Science Club meets Tuesday, September 22 @ the Bell House, 149 7th St. (between 2nd and 3rd avenues) in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Subway: F or G to 4th Ave, R to 9th St.

Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat

WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ. 

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)

Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Do you fancy yourself a game developer, but not sure where to start? Are you looking for real examples of how to use the new iOS 9 game frameworks? We are featuring two seasoned developers who've made their games happen in their spare time and want to share these insights with us.

This month we're back in Brooklyn at Kickstarter HQ in Greenpoint!

** PLEASE NOTE: RSVPs will be checked at the door so please include your real name in your RSVP or you won't get in **

Pizza, Beer and non-alcoholic beverages will be provided.


Joseph McMahon: SpriteKit as an Intro to SceneKit and Metal
Apple's upcoming iOS 9 and OS X 10.11 include some hot new features and frameworks that utilize the native GPU. Joe is going to talk about why you should first get your hands dirty with SpriteKit, and then SceneKit, before taking on Metal.

Bio: Joe is the founder of Orbert - releasing for iOS 9 in December. He is a 3D graphics and robotics programmer who first picked up Swift when Apple announced it at WWDC 2014.


Salvatore Randazzo: Creating an Indie iOS Game (in Swift) Without Quitting your Day Job
"You can’t fake fun." Learn about the success of the indie iOS game Specimen, the many failed attempts it took to "get it right", and how Swift transformed the development process mid-way through. See functional-programming concepts applied to game development, and learn how to speed up your development process by writing your own DSLs. 

Bio: Sal is the lead iOS developer at Paperless Post. During his nights and weekends, he doubles as the lead developer on Specimen, which was released this past July on the App Store.

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

David

results.description:
This is a partner event - RSVP here: http://bit.ly/BSCSharingEcon**

Special 25% Discount for members of the NY Sharing Economy Meetup: BSC-NYSharingEconomyMeetup

Join Be Social Change on Tuesday, September 22nd for a panel discussion on the Future of The Sharing Economy as we explore the trends and challenges of the collaborative consumption.

From cars and music to accommodations and staffing, it’s never been easier for anyone with an excess capacity of goods and services to maximize their resources through collaborative consumption. Commonly referred to as The Sharing Economy, these transactions minimize waste and environmental impact, save costs, cut down barriers to entry, and increase productivity in a mutual give-and-receive exchange.

Expected to grow from $15 billion to $335 billion in revenue from 2013 to 2025, The Sharing Economy is positioned to disrupt traditional renting sectors like automotive and hotels. This potential for growth has attracted entrepreneurs and corporations alike, but how does it trickle down and increase opportunities and returns for individuals at every level of the exchange? And when are words like “community” and “sharing” disguising purely profit-driven transactions, a strategy coined as ‘WeWashing’?

With thought leaders from across the sector, this panel discussion will delve into the opportunities and challenges that come with collective collaboration. We’ll highlight the distinction between the Access Economy - where consumers are primarily interested in low costs and convenience - and an authentic Sharing Economy, rooted in trust and the strengthening of communities, and explore when, how, and if The Sharing Economy can be a source of empowerment.
results.name: Partner Event - Be Social Change: The Future of the Sharing Economy

 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

We'll meet just inside the park entrance at 52nd St. and 39th Dr. at 7:00pm for our 3ish mile loop around Woodside, Sunnyside and parts of LIC. You can run at your own comfortable and totally non-competitive pace and know that we'll never leave you behind.

We usually head to the pub for beverages and/or snacks afterward - Bring some cash if you would like to participate in our post-run social time.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt.

As always, if you have any comments, ideas or suggestions, please let us know!
