results.description:
This NOW TUESDAY night gaming session will be constructed deck open gaming, with the games being seated in a first come first seated format. So the first four people to show up start a game, then the next four people start a game, and as players are ousted a third game starts, etc.

We'll be playing two hour rounds from 7pm through about 11pm. Having the games with a time limit means we are more likely to get more games in and you can try out more than one deck in a night.

If you'd like help with deck construction, players are often more than willing to give advice, lend cards for the evening and do other assorted friendly things to help another player in between rounds. Also, playing in person is a great way to meet other players you can later meet up with on your own to discuss the game more later over email or phone.

If you have questions, feel free to message me or Adam on here and we'll gladly answer.

 

See you there!

Ray

results.description:
Brush up on old techniques and learn new ones! This six week workshop focuses on the basic tenets of drawing; line quality, sighting and measuring, perspective and tone as they pertain to the daily practice of documenting our thoughts, ideas, creative impulses and the physical world around us. In the process, we'll cover still life, figure, landscape, architectural and conceptual drawing.

A keystone of the course will involve the keeping of an artist's sketch journal. We will be exploring the sketch as a record of time, and the drawing as a physical representation of the artist's thought process.

Sign up to reserve a seat online via Shoestring Press: https://squareup.com/market/shoestring-press/foundation-drawing-with-jenny-carolin

results.description:
Mattias is a seasoned, serial entrepreneur with over 17 years in the space and on his third company - Spring.

Spring is a training platform that combines music, technology, and curation to make you move happier and easier.

Prior to Spring, Mattias cofounded Jango, an early internet radio based startup, in 2006 and ran the company for nearly 6 years.

Before THAT he worked on a startup during the dot com bubble where he helped the company IPO.

Now if that doesn't make for a good #WarStories session, I don't know what does!

---

Let's get inspired! 

Come to learn, get involved, and meet other cool people passionate about building great companies.


RSVP & join us.

FALL VOLLEYBALL SEASON REGISTRATION GOING ON NOW! Attend our  Open Scrimmage on Thursday September 17th or Tuesday Sept. 22nd to get on a team.

We are NY York's Largest Adult Social Volleyball League featuring ALL LEVELS OF PLAY. Last year's Fall League featured over 270 teams! Whether you're a beginner, a fierce competitor or just looking to meet new people and go out for a drink after the game, we have a division for you. Teams and Individuals Welcome. We offer the Best Coed, Men's and Women's competition in NYC!

Season begins September 28th and includes 10 matches, 1 pre-season scrimmage plus playoffs & inter-divisional playoffs for qualifying teams. All Games are held in the evenings Monday through Thursday nights in Manhattan Gyms.

NO TEAM? NO PROBLEM! Join as an individual and pay $127.50. Come to the Open Scrimmage on Thurs.  9/17  or Tues 9/22 @ 7pm. Meet players and form a team with new friends. results.description:
This is not a meetup based on language learning but it is a great opportunity to laugh, play, connect, & feel excited as you share your dreams & goals with like minded positive supportive people!!

This meetup will be hosted by my dear friend and mentor Matthew Croteau (www.matthewcroteau.com)

Do you still have a Dream or Goal you aspire to make happen but feel a bit stuck or drained?

Do you feel you’ve got this potential but for some reason haven’t been able to convert it into the money or lifestyle you deserve?

Do you feel you work hard & put in the time but haven’t seen the payoff yet & wonder when if ever will it happen?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions, you'll absolutely love this meetup event. During this meetup I’ll be sharing with you the truth about how the universe works & the most important spiritual laws you must understand to obtain the life you deserve & to feel your best/happiest again!

I promise you’ll feel more alive, free, grateful, & happy then ever before once you learn these laws.

You'll learn how to instantly dissolve anything that gets int he way from you feeling your BEST!

This information should have been taught to us in school but for some reason it was withheld until now!

You’ll also have an opportunity to network, connect, & exchange contact info with like minded people right in your community! I think we could all use more of these people in our lives! Learn the secret to raising your confidence to an all time sustainable high & break free from the old self you used to be.

Have so much fun interacting & practicing amongst this dynamic, smart, like minded group

A Free one on one with Matt - 30 minute Coaching Session will be Given Away to a Lucky Winner! (A drawing will be held at the end of the Meetup)

Also - Each Attendee will be given a personal booklet to fill out & follow along as we go. This booklet was designed as a structure to support & help you continue the learning during & after the Meetup.

Find out more about Matthew at www.matthewcroteau.com

Save $5 by paying now via PayPal at [masked]

Send your $5 payment and you're ready to attend!

results.description:
Please Join us on September 22nd Guest Teacher -  Ashin Vimala

Ashin Vimala is visiting White Plains Zen and has offered to share his tradition with us on Tuesday. 

Vimala ordained with Sayadaw U Tejaniya, a kind and wise great spiritual friend who is also quite lovable and humorous.  Based at Shwe Oo Min Dhamma Sukha Forest Monastery in Myanmar and currently practicing as a free range monk.  He is the grateful beneficiary of generous teachers from a variety of traditions, cultures, races, religions and walks of life, suffered deeply from a horde of traumas and addictions and is happier now.

His practice interests include: right view, a warm friendly knowing what's happening in the moment, continuity of awareness, understanding reality as it is with an open heart mind, and friendly sharing of experience with others.

Please Join us!

Questions or comments? Contact us at: E-Mail: [masked]
website: whiteplainszen.org <a>[masked]</a>
St. Bartholmew's Church 82 Prospect St. White Plains, NY 10606

Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in the Cafe that works very well, so you are welcome to bring your laptop if you like.

We hope to see you there! It's always a blast!!!

results.description:
NYFG members, 

Join us on Tues Sept 22nd for the screening of "Affliction" written and directed by NYFG member Prabal Chakraborty and produced through the New York Film Group at the New Filmmakers Anthology Film Archives. 

AFFLICTION is a relationship drama about an independent-minded woman MELANIE whose life is changed when she realizes that her stance of keeping her daughter MERYL away from her divorced husband, JOHN, is causing her daughter more harm than good. 

This screening, is part of a program of three shorts. Tickets are only $6 at the box office. The filmmakers and producers will be present and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet and network with fellow filmmakers.

Tickets   http://www.newfilmmakers.com/ 

Trailer     http://www.newyorkfilmgroup.com/#!affiction/c20bh 

We look forward to seeing you there!!

TJ Collins

NYFG Co-Founder & Organizer

www.newyorkfilmgroup.com

www.facebook.com/Newyorkfilmgroup

results.description:
Meditation leads to inner peace, overcomes loneliness, improves relationships, and has many other benefits for mind and body. We will investigate how meditation works to calm our mind throughout our busy life. Find out how to fit an enjoyable meditation practice into your present lifestyle, and learn time tested methods for improving mindfulness, concentration, and happiness. Beginners and those wanting to continue to learn meditation are welcome in this class.

Concetta Lamore has been a Kadampa meditation practitioner for over 7 years. She exudes gratitude for the wisdom derived from her study of Buddhism and her joyful daily practice. She feels blessed to be able to share the many ways in which our lives can be filled with inner peace and happiness.
results.name: Learning to Meditate ~ Everyone Welcome 7:30pm with Concetta Lamore

results.description:
Join us Tuesday for West Coast Swing at Slate, a cool venue with wood floors, mood lighting, great sound system, yummy drinks & fun dancing. Extended Happy Hour for dancers from 4pm until 9 pm!

Leveled Lessons We are excited to offer two leveled classes from 7:30 - 8:30 pm, NO PARTNER needed! Dancers rotate during class. Each week will focus on a different set of skills and will help take each dancer to the next level of their dancing! The level 1 class is for anyone who would like to learn the basics of west coast swing. The level 2 class is for dancers who have learned and are comfortable with the basics. Click for complete Class Details.


Free Games Slate is offering free games to dancers from 7:30 - 8:30 pm when you buy a drink or food. You can play pool, ping pong, shuffleboard, and more. It is an awesome deal and a great way to relax after work.

Dance Party Party with rotating DJs spinning fantastic West Coast Swing tunes from 8:30pm until midnight! The party is $12 at the door or prepay online for $10. Get $5 cash back if you spend $20+ at the bar.

Credit cards accepted at admission desk.  Credit cards accepted at admission desk. No outside food, water or drinks. 21+ over event only ID required.


Check out NOWDancing.com for more information and to Register!
results.name: West Coast Swing Dancing @ Strictly Tuesday

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

The NYC Atheists’ Advanced Writers Group, now going for two years, is open to talented writers who want the support and camaraderie of other secular writers in polishing their work and getting happily published.  Our group meets once a month; we gently critique each other’s work, but our main focus is on helping each other get published. There is no charge for this workshop; we ask only that you commit to meeting once a month, reading the work of the other members and offering your suggestions for improvement in an upbeat, encouraging manner.

What do we mean by “advanced writers?”

We mean those writers who are close to being published or have already been published in some form. We also mean writers who, we can see by reading samples of their writing, have great potential but until now have not been mentored or encouraged to treat their work seriously or to aim for publication.

How do you know if you fit our criteria for a writer with promise?

You don’t.  Writers are often poor judges of the level of their talent. We suggest that you give us the opportunity to judge that, because we can often sense that spark of talent even if you yourself do not.  Additionally, we have recently instituted a new member category, dubbed “Apprentice author”--individuals who demonstrate potential but who have not yet been published anywhere or achieved commercial capability.

Submit a Sample

If you are interested in joining this kind of a close and involved group of writers, submit a sample of your writing (15 pages or less) to the group,plus a personal letter telling us a little about your background, what you are aiming for and what you think we can do for you. Your sample submission may be a play, fiction or non-fiction. If fiction, it can be a short story or a chapter of a book.  If non-fiction, the sample can be an article or a chapter of a non-fiction book. If a play, send only Act One.

If you are accepted into the group, we ask only that you encourage and support each group member by reading his or her material, critiquing it in a kindly, professional manner and attend our monthly meeting to discuss it in a group setting. There is no charge whatsoever for membership in the Advanced Writers Group.  Our goal is to encourage more good secular writers to enter the literary marketplace.

Bear in mind that once you are accepted, everyone in the group accepts that you are headed for publication; this is not a “learn to write” group. This is a group whose members have shown themselves to have solid skills and need only minimum critiquing or, more importantly, encouragement in tackling the publishing industry, which, when done alone, can be discouraging. We are there as friends, as your cheerleaders, your mentors, your colleagues.

Jane Everhart, Facilitator  NYCA Advanced Writers Group

NYC ATHEISTS CONTACT: [masked]

TO APPLY, PLEASE SEND A SAMPLE OF YOUR WRITING (15 pages or less) plus a brief bio and a letter telling us what you think we can do for you, to:

NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group                                                                                                c/o NYC Atheists Inc.                                                                                                                        Box 6060 NY, NY[masked]

Central Park is the most popular of parks for foragers. Because of its varied habitats and the combination of wild and cultivated, native, and exotic plants, Central Park is a great place to forage, even in the winter and early-spring. Here are some of the species we'll be finding:

In the Ramble, we'll be finding large stands of field garlic, with mild-flavored onion-like bulbs, plus the tender young leaves, which you use like chives.

The bland leaves of lesser celandine, magical in the way they remove the bitterness of dandelions (and other bitter greens), also in season, will be at their peak, and the leaves of goutweed, which taste like parsley, only better, will already be growing.

The season's first sweet-and-sharp daylily shoots will be popping up along the embankment of the reservoir—a treat for all.

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat


WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ.  

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)


Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.


Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Philosopher of science and spirituality Nancy Abrams will address the issues in her newest book A God That Could Be Real , “a paradigm-shifting blend of science and religion and philosophy for agnostic, spiritual and scientifically-minded readers.” Abandoning traditional arguments for and against God that vilify either science or religion, Abrams explores a radically new way of thinking about God while dismantling several common assumptions. She shows us why an omniscient, omnipotent God is incompatible with science but still does not preclude the idea of a God that can comfort and empower us. Abrams helps to bridge the gap left by the culture wars between organized religion and modern science over God and cosmic knowledge. Beyond providing individual inspiration to face personal challenges, Abrams makes a compelling case that a shared understanding of a God that could be real is a planetary imperative necessary to overcome existential challenges like the slow-moving calamities of climate change, resource depletion, and mass extinction.



Nancy Ellen Abrams

is a philosopher of science, lawyer and author. She and her husband, world-renowned cosmologist Joel Primack, developed a new visual language to express the big ideas underlying the new universe picture that Primack helped to create. For ten years they co-taught a course titled “Cosmology and Culture” at the University of California, Santa Cruz which won prizes from the Templeton Foundation and the American Council of Learned Sciences. The course led to their co-authoring The View from the Center of the Universe: Discovering Our Extraordinary Place in the Cosmos (Penguin/Riverhead, 2006). In 2009 Yale University invited them to give the prestigious Terry Lectures which they rewrote to become The New Universe and the Human Future: How a Shared Cosmology Could Transform the World (Yale, 2011). Together Abrams and Primack have spoken at universities and other venues around the world.
results.name: 8 pmA God That Could Be Real: Spirituality, Science and the Future of Our Planet

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.5 and above)***


Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights from till 11 pm.

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:

1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.

4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:

• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.

• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
NYPH is teaming up with our Bronze Sponsor Cosella-Dorken to bring to you this Climate Week special event! The event will be held at Building Energy Exchange (BEEX), our event location partner. 


ABOUT THE PRESENTER: 


Todd Kimmel, CPHC and Technical Consultant at Cosella-Dorken, will be presenting about Exterior Air Barriers in relation to Passive House construction. Don't miss this opportunity to dive deeper into the world of Passive House, all while networking with other members of the Passive House community.



CREDITS OFFERED: 


AIA/CES 1 Credit LU / HSW 



COURSE DESCRIPTION: 


Exterior Air Barrier Systems - High Performance Buildings - Part 1

Air barrier systems are becoming a more important concern for modern, high performance commercial buildings.  This presentation will help you understand changing codes and standards, why air tightness is important for commercial buildings, and how to detail exterior air barrier systems.  Because air tightness is a “whole building” characteristic that depends on the work of multiple trades, we will also look at commissioning and inspection during construction.  You will come away with a stronger understanding of how air barrier systems work and how to solve common problems in design and construction. 


Learning Objectives: 

At the end of this course, participants will be able to: 

• Understand the importance of air control for high performance commercial buildings, including energy efficiency, durability, occupant health and comfort.

• Understand the fundamental building science behind air control and air barrier systems.

• Be able to identify critical air barrier details during design and understand common solutions for high performance enclosures.

• Be able to inspect and test air barriers and air barrier components on construction mock-ups or during construction.


REGISTER:


Sign up here on Meetup.  Admission is $10 for non-NYPH members. 

As always, NYPH  Professional & Manufacturer members can attend for FREE. Not yet a member? Join here and get access to all member benefits including: 


FREE Access to Events 
FREE Publicity for your Company/Organization in our Directories 
Passipedia Access 
Passive+ Magazine Online Access 
Exclusive Member Meetings/Networking Opportunities 
Discounts to Events Like the Annual NYPH Conference & Expo

Find out more about sponsoring NYPH by clicking here. We value our sponsors and rely on your help!

Event Partner: Building Energy Exchange.
results.name: CLIMATE WEEK - Exterior Air Barrier Systems - High Performance Buildings

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
We're going to do a basic Kung Fu class that includes stretching and core conditioning, basic martial arts techniques (like strikes and kicks) and pair practice in the unique art of Eagle Claw Kung Fu. We have two class leaders  so you get plenty of help learning and perfecting your technique. 

This lunchtime workout is designed to provide a solid kung fu class in one of martial arts' most powerful and unusual systems — Shaolin Eagle Claw. It's based on the powerful grip and attack style of the Eagle. Sound exotic? Well, it's  fast, lethal and super for self-defense, as well as a beautiful martial arts practice. Our two instructors our dedicated and you will be too once you try it.


And did we mention—it's fun. So make the most of your midday break, and try some kung fu. Not only will you get fit and centered, you'll learn something really meaningful.

results.description:
Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.

Don't be late, we start on time!


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.name: Learn Public Speaking - New York City near Grand Central Station - Toastmasters

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 1:00 PM – 2:30 PM

Day: Wednesdays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

Thank you everyone for joining us this week to kick off the Fall 2015 HITLAB Seminar Series, a space for those present to exchange thoughts and ideas around innovation in healthcare design and delivery.


At the forefront of cutting-edge biomedical and public health innovation, our HITLAB teams explore complex and interesting problems that significantly impact global healthcare access and delivery. We ideate, create, and evaluate innovative solutions to healthcare challenges for companies, foundations, multi-lateral agencies, and governments. In partnership with others whose missions align with ours, we independently, ethically, and efficiently design studies, programs, and products that improve healthcare access and quality throughout the world.

results.description:
IMPORTANT: You must register to access the training (your RSVP is not enough) https://theatreaid.leadpages.co/crowdfunding-training/
This is also where you can choose your time slot.

How to create a successful crowdfunding VIDEO is for:

Writers, performers, musicians, fine artists and any other creative beings who are curious about crowdfunding and want to know how to use it to help you create your art work.

Learn how to create a rocking crowdfunding video that will take you less time to make and will bring you more money into your campaign.

Learn what the 6 most common mistakes artists tend to make with their crowdfunding videos.

Hi, I'm Tal Jakubowiczova and I specialise in supporting artists’ crowdfunding campaigns to success.
There is quite a lot of advice about crowdfunding for businesses, but not much for creatives, and the unique funding challenges we face - even though it was creatives who started crowdfunding as we know it!
So this webinar is all about crowdfunding creative style!

In this 2 hour session we'll cover:

• What other 2 major things you can get from crowdfunding (apart for cash)

• The main reason people will give money to your project

• What the worst mistakes you can make when creating a crowdfunding video are...and how to avoid them

• Plus much more info you need to know to start your successful crowdfunding adventure

• I will also be answering your individual crowdfunding questions.

Please message me below with any questions.
Hope to see many of you there.

Please register here to get your unique access link to our virtual training room.
https://theatreaid.leadpages.co/crowdfunding-training/

Keep creative,
Tal
results.name: How to create a successful crowdfunding VIDEO

results.description:
If you want lots of excitement and something to do to get you through the week, come race with us Wednesday nights.   About 30 boats in 4 classes race around the buoys in Raritan Bay.   Boats range from J109s to J24's, Shields, Beneteaus.   Many of the captains are international racers and very competitive.

https://youtu.be/XmbbrIQAfFY
video of sailing races


Races start at 5:45, but you have to get on the boat, get it ready,  and out to the race area, so plan to be there,  by 4:30-4:45.  


Often, regular crew is on vacation during the summer and substitutes are needed.  Some of the larger boats can always use an extra hand and crewing is a great way to learn how to sail.  

Afterwards, join us at the bar and for supper.

If you want to come crew, let me know in advance with a direct email with contact info: cell# and email so I can find you a boat. 


Sail fast, live slow.

Context: We meet to practice our public speaking and to support others in their skill development by providing feedback. The meeting is usually structured into sections devoted to prepared speeches, unprepared speeches, and the evaluation of those speeches.

results.description:
Let's celebrate the first day of Fall at Hudson Common with the Swiss Ski Club of NY. Join us for Happy Hour at this modern-day beer hall and burger joint.


We can partake of a wide selection of local craft beers, inventive preparations of classic American fare, and soda shoppe-inspired specialty cocktails. The menu focuses on classic "Common" and unconventional "Uncommon" interpretations of burgers, sandwiches and fries, prepared with market fresh ingredients, and the beverage program is anchored by 16 beer taps, pouring the best locally brewed beers from Brooklyn, Long Island, the Hudson Valley, Southampton, and Pennsylvania.


Weather permitting, Hudson Common's oversized glass doors will unfold into a grass-strewn patio, adorned with oversized planters, picnic tables, corn hole and strings of flashbulbs illuminating overhead.


LOCATION & DIRECTIONS


On the ground floor, just off the lobby


356 West 58th Street, New York NY 10019


N/R/Q to 57th Street/7th Ave


1/B/D to Columbus Circle

Please look for us, we will save a space and have lots of Swiss Ski Club flyers etc. Reservations are not required.


Questions email Noreen [masked]
results.name: Let's celebrate the first day of Fall at Hudson Common with the Swiss Ski Club

results.description:
"Are you less than thrilled with your current job? Do you want to catapult your career to higher pay, a better job title and more responsibility but don't know how to pull it off? Ryan Renteria explains how you can apply his unique and proven process to rapidly accelerate your career trajectory. The discussion includes communication, networking, research, standing out, behavioral biases, and mindset.

Ryan Renteria is an expert in how to catapult up the career curve. He earned enormous responsibility within his first three months at every job: advising Goldman Sachs' largest clients, convincing a leading hedge fund to make its largest investment in history and influencing the Indiana Pacers' key personnel .
results.name: Catapult Up The Career Curve, Not Let Your Career Keep You Down

results.description:
Join us for a regular play scrimmage session. (If you don't have experience kayaking w/ a skirt--rolling or doing a wet exit--please attend one of our Intro Sessions first. Come early to get set up if you need to use club gear. We hope to be on the water close to 6:30.

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo). 

We may or may not set up a goal for this session, depending on numbers, but we can play the "football" version which is good fun and helps with your passing game.
results.how_to_find_us: W 26th St @ Hudson River (middle of the boathouse or on back deck)
results.name: Regular Session (P66)

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Abstract:

8 out of 10 couples use TheKnot.com to help plan their wedding. A key part of planning involves selecting articles, photographs, and other resources and storing these in the user's Favorites. Recently we migrated major parts of our technology stack to open source technologies. As part of our migration strategy, we zeroed in on MongoDB, since it better suited our requirements for speed and data structure as well as eliminating the need for a caching layer. The transition required a period in which both our legacy and new API where working concurrently with data being persisted on both databases (SQL and Mongo) and all records were being synched with every request. We resourced to many strategies and applications to achieve this goal, including: Pentaho, AWS SQS and SNS, a queue messenger system and some proprietary ruby gems. In this session we will review our strategy and some of the lessons we learned about successfully migrating with zero downtime.

Bio:

Vlad Carballo is a Software Engineer, agile practitioner and analytical thinker with proven skills architecting and implementing multi-layer applications for the enterprise.
Consistently resolves ongoing issues while working in a team environment. Always interested in collaborating with a dynamic group following the SOLID Principles and Agile Practices.

After have been working with multiple database and Microsoft technologies for more than 17 years, in 2012 took an opportunity and switched to the Open Source, dynamic languages and NoSQL world. Since then has been responsible for several solutions implemented on Rails and backed up by MongoDB, CouchDb and Redis. Currently working as a Sr. Software Engineer at XO Group Inc. where he has been a key player in the company’s transition from the .NET to the Rails stack.

Bio:

Alexander Copquin is a Senior Software Engineer at Xo Group Inc.  He has worked on both the electronics and software arena. His work experience spans more than 2 decades on several countries (Argentina, Canada and the U.S.) on a many companies, from small start-ups to full fledged corporations. He has worked on a variety of stacks and database technologies including SQL Server, Postgres, Neo4J and MongoDb. He currently works on the Membership and Community team where he participated in the re-platforming of all applications from .NET to Ruby on Rails. He also holds a degree in music performance and loves the inherent harmony that arises from beautiful written code.
results.name: Migration from SQL to MongoDB - A Case Study at TheKnot.com

results.description:
Bluemix Hack Hours are tech talk + hacking, learn and practice. Bring your laptop, code on your project, learn, hang out, have a drink, eat something, we have labs to work on with technical support onsite, or just meet other developers. 


Now IBM has acquired Node.js experts StrongLoop, Arpitha will demonstrate the Loopback platform, if you love Node.js you will like Loopback.

http://t.co/fHJmEW9c0I


For those interested there will be a 30 minutes tech talk to highlight one of the many technologies on Bluemix, from Java, Node.js, MongoDB, Containers, Docker, Cloud Foundry, Big Data Analytics, Python, Java, Hadoop, Twilio, Pitney Bowes, Watson, IoT, MQTT, Mobile, Push Notifications, Continuous Integration and others.

AGENDA

6.00 sit down, go easy,

6.30 today's tech talk: How to use the Strongloop API Platform for Node.js


7.00 hack away (we have a Strongloop Lab you can work on) hack food provided


9.00 wrapping up

Hosted @WeWork, with free food and drinks provided.

Space is limited, considerately sign up if you plan to attend. Feel free to ask questions or contact me.
results.name: Bluemix Hack Hours 3 (with tech talk: Strongloop API Platform for Node.js)

results.description:
If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

For more information about Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: This is on 3rd Avenue at 45th Street
results.name: You're invited to a Humorous Toastmasters meeting

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New & Existing Member Social Networking & Welcome Party--Free Event

results.description:
CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP
or Call[masked]

About the Author
Loch Kelly is an educator, consultant, and recognized leader in the field of meditation and psychotherapy who was asked to teach meditation by Mingyur Rinpoche and Adyashanti. 

The founder of the Awake Awareness Institute, he is an emerging voice in modernizing meditation, teaching inner city youth and collaborating with neuroscientists to study how awareness training can enhance well-being. He lives in New York City. 

See lochkelly.org. Book Signing, Talk, and Meditation with Acclaimed Meditation Teacher Loch Kelly.

All are welcome to join Loch Kelly as he shares insights and meditations from his new book that combines ancient wisdom teachings with contemporary neuroscience and psychotherapy. 

Loch, who is authorized to teach by Adyashanti and Mingyur Rinpoche, has synthesized advanced meditation practices into simple methods that can be done in the midst of your every day life. 

Please join us for this book signing. Shift Into Freedom, by Loch Kelly is being called a “threshold book like Eckhart Tolle’s Power of Now.”
results.name: Book Signing Talk & Meditation w/Acclaimed MeditationTeacher & Author Loch Kelly

group.name: Namaste Bookshop & Healing Center Meetup Group NYC

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.
results.name: Wednesday soccer @ 6PM.

results.description:
**Please click here to RSVP through our website (MANDATORY)**

If you did not sign up for the class through the website, you will not be able to attend!

Course Requirements: 

A Mac/Windows laptop capable of running Eclipse. Eclipse can be downloaded at http://bit.ly/1h1kFNv (system requirements for Eclipse also found here). Please also remember to have the latest Java JDK on your machine (download here). 

No prior programming knowledge needed.

What you will learn:

2 hour Beginner Java lesson that will teach the fundamentals of java while building a simple application that reads your Fortune!

Follow up Courses:

Build your own Android App from scratch in our upcoming Bootcamp!

Click here to sign up:  http://beginnerprogrammers.nyc/android-bootcamp/
results.name: Create a Fortune Teller [Intro to Java]

venue.address_1: 142 Main Street (corner of Franklin and Main - the entrance is off the rear parking lot)
venue.name: Helen Hayes Studios

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music and developing your dance technique, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality in depth instruction.

The atmosphere is relaxed and noncompetative, where questions are an encouraged and a valued part of our learning process.

The ballet Instruction is grounded in the Italian and Russian classical traditions. It is guided by a focus on the dancer's bio-mechanics, as effected by their body placement and rhythmic dynamics. 

Whether you are continuing your training or returning to ballet, this is the class for you. Ballet also provides a strong foundation for other dance techniques. Whether your central dance interest is classical dance or other techniques this will a valuable class for you.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.

Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).

Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR

Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK

For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.
results.name: ADULT BALLET CLASS Level: Intermediate

results.description:
Join Facebook, Portland Communications, ComRes and the Digital Diplomacy Coalition to discuss the most accurate index of national soft power ever produced.

We are delighted to invite you to a panel event to discuss The Soft Power 30, which Joseph Nye described as "The clearest picture to date of global soft power".

The nature of global power is rapidly evolving, precipitating far-reaching economic and political changes affecting nations of every size and standing. Today’s multipolar world is punctuated by challenges that are inherently trans-national, where unilateral action rarely succeeds in delivering favourable outcomes of consequence.

In this new and evolving context, soft power – the ability to achieve objectives through attraction, and persuasion – is ever more crucial to the effective conduct of foreign policy and ultimately shaping global events.


SPEAKERS:

Matthew Rycroft, Ambassador and Permanent Representative at UK Mission to the UN

Moira Whelan, Deputy Assistant Secretary for Digital Strategy, U.S. Department of State

Giorgio Pompilio, Deputy Consul General of Switzerland

Jonathan McClory, Partner at Portland, author of The Soft Power 30 and one of the world's leading experts on soft power

Katie Harbath, Global Politics and Government Outreach Manager, Facebook

REGISTER HERE: https://softpower30.splashthat.com/
results.name: Soft Power 30

results.description:
Meet fellow dark scientists at the upcoming #HackGotham event taking place Sept 23 @ URBO in Times Square NYC.

This is the bleeding edge of technology. Be there.

The aim of #HackGotham is to bridge entertainment, underground hacking culture and enterprise information security concepts. This event is the pre-party for the upcoming CTF that will be announced at a later date. We want to hear your ideas on the types of challenges you would like to see in the game, and what the concept of 'hacking tournaments' mean to you. This way we can build the biggest, baddest CTF that's ever been seen.

Hackers, entrepreneurs, coders, and OGs will have an opportunity to swap notes about the latest trends within information security corporate culture and the hacking underground.

We will have an art exhibit by Alan Steinfeld of New Realities who will showcasing his thought provoking double exposure photographs.

Sponsored by:
Bit by Bit Computer Consultants, Inc. URBO Music by Molly Ryan

Contact: Natasha Pelak
[masked]

Our One Year Anniversary

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

venue.name: Montclair State Feliciano School of Business building (room 101)

results.description:
With the thousands of different marketing options in the world, business owners often become overwhelmed with what route to take when using social media to market to their customers online. In this meetup, we will discuss the secret ingredient that most business owners and marketers overlook. Let's call it the “DNA” of your marketing campaign, or the buyer’s persona. The psychology of a buyer's persona when they use social media has been the differentiator on why campaigns are successful and unsuccessful. This meetup will help business owners, marketers, and entrepreneurs leverage their buyer's persona data to target ads that will convert on the social channels that they use, and pin-point what social channels they should focus on.

Panelists:
Nick Bulwin, founder/CEO, Second Flight Consultancy
Kelly McCaughey, marketing director, Grey Sky Films Video Production Agency
Samantha Pena, content strategist at Hudson Integrated Web Agency
Moderator: Michael Benyo, president, The Evolution Management Group

Event is co-sponsored with Residence Life.

Agenda:
6:00-6:45 p.m. Networking with pizza
6:45-7:00 p.m. Welcome and 1-minute pitches from the audience
7:00-8:30 p.m. Panel discussion with audience Q&A

Directions and parking info: Park in the Red Hawk Deck on campus, exit the deck on Level 5 and proceed straight up the walkway (soccer field will be on your left) to the new School of Business building.


Join the conversation on Twitter and Instagram: #MSUmeetup and @FelicianoCenter

Speaker bios:
Nick Bulwin is the Founder/CEO of Second Flight Consultancy. Nick has been involved in online marketing and growth hacking since 2006, and has developed an agency that is focused on finding the hidden ways businesses can accelerate growth through online marketing efforts, building scalable systems, and developing deep buyer persona that can crack the code for profits. Second Flight's philosophy is that every business is looking to get from Point A to Point B in their business goals, and often times there is a lag in getting to Point B. Our mission is to be that connecting flight (or Second Flight) in getting them to their goals. Twitter: @NickBulwin 

Kelly McCaughey is the Marketing Director at Grey Sky Films Video Production Agency. Kelly graduated Rutgers with a BS in Anthropology, focused on human behavior and psychology, an experience in a variety of fields including product and graphic design, communications, as well as advertising research. Kelly started at Grey Sky Films as an Account Executive & Strategist, working with the production team and a diverse range of clients to identify and achieve content marketing goals. As Marketing Director she creates content and collateral to support the customer’s buying journey. Twitter: @greyskyfilms


</a><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=ADEAAApg3k8BFAGXNmpRBZGT92OnjicAfykU0KI&authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=EMpA&locale=en_US&srchid=498427061441143878405&srchindex=1&srchtotal=118&trk=vsrp_people_res_name&trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A498427061441143878405%2CVSRPtargetId%3A174120527%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary%2CVSRPnm%3Atrue%2CauthType%3ANAME_SEARCH">Samantha Pena is the Content Strategist at Hudson Integrated Web Agency, where she works in the digital marketing team to develop and implement Content Marketing, SEO, and Inbound Marketing strategies. With a strong focus on user experience optimization, it’s not unusual to find her poring over spreadsheets of data in order to discover hidden conversion and engagement opportunities for her clients. Twitter: @Samantha_Pena16 @HudsonHorizons

Michael Benyo has over 25 years of leadership experience in professional services, technical consulting and executive training. Mike has worked with clients within a wide range of verticals. His extensive background includes Financial Services, Retail, Telecommunications, Entertainment, Travel, Satellite Services and Media, working with clients such as AT&T, Viacom, Avaya, Paine Webber, General Motors.
results.name: What Makes Customers Click

results.description:
Join us for our weekly hacknight for Django developers + newcomers to work on their projects and/or connect with other developers. For best results, bring your laptop.

Say hello on IRC! We're #django-nyc on Freenode. 

About our host </a><a href="http://www.pace.edu/seidenberg/">Seidenberg School of Pace University

The Seidenberg School of Pace University combines a passion for technology with a strong sense of community. Alongside our computing programs, we run workshops, events and meet-ups that bring like-minded individuals together to learn something cool and have a good time. Seidenberg also hosts Hackathons and summer programs for high schoolers – giving everyone a chance to learn coding in a university setting.

iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.

WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. results.description:
Only $175 for the entire 13 week semester! Please email or message el centro to confirm we are still accepting students before coming to this class. 

In the Level 3 Spanish class students will already have a working knowledge, but more advanced capacity, in the basics of conversation. At this level students will be expected to have gained the ability to read and write simple sentences. The main objectives of Level 3 will be to improve fluidity, improve vocabulary and improve overall understanding of spoken and written Spanish. After one term in level 3 students will be prepared for basic and brief conversations. After two terms in level 3 students will have finished with the a more advanced conversational ability in anticipation of the level 4 environment. 

En la clase de Nivel 3 de español, alumnos ya tendrán un conocimiento práctico pero mas avanzado en cuanto los conceptos básicos de conversación.  En éste nivel se esperará que los estudiantes han obtenido la capacidad de leer y escribir oraciones simples.  Los principales objetivos del nivel 3 serán mejorar la fluidez de los estudiantes, mejorar el vocabulario y mejorar la comprensión general del español hablado y escrito.  Después de un semestre en el nivel 3 los estudiantes estarán preparados para conversaciones básicas y breves.  Después de dos semestres en el nivel 3 los alumnos terminaran con la capacidad para conversaciones y comunicaciones escritas mas avanzadas en anticipación al ambiente del nivel 4.
results.name: Spanish 3 - Intermediate Conversational Spanish

results.description:
Only $175 for the entire 13 week semester! Please email or message el centro to confirm we are still accepting students before coming to this class.


The Level 2 Spanish class is for students who already have the ability to form and understand simple sentences. Students will expand their vocabulary in Spanish and learn to use past tenses. The use of the present tense will also continue and students will also be introduced to the combination of tenses.  Students will participate in discussions, songs and games and will improve their reading and writing skills at a basic level, but with more understanding on the formation of sentences and phrases. The lessons will focus on the use of the Spanish language for common situations such as ordering in restaurants, planning a trip, visits to the doctor and employment.

La clase de Nivel 2 de español es para estudiantes que ya tienen la capacidad de formar y entender oraciones sencillas en español. Los estudiantes ampliarán su vocabulario y aprenderán a usar los tiempos en el pasado.  El uso del presente tambien continuará y los alumnos también serán introducidos a la combinación de los tiempos verbales.  Los estudiantes participarán en conversaciones, canciones y juegos y mejorarán sus habilidades en la lectura y la escritura en español a un nivel basico, pero con mas entendimiento sobre la formación de oraciones y frases.  Las lecciones se concentrarán en el uso del idioma con la práctica de situaciones comunes como ordenar en restaurantes, la planificación de un viaje, visitas al medico y el empleo.

Our Basic Computer courses are centered around student needs. We offer levels 1 and 2 depending on the class size and skill level. Our teachers combine their computer knowledge and love of teaching to create a classroom environment that caters to all students with a variety of interests and skill levels.
Computers 1 focuses on how to operate a PC, using a mouse, typing, navigating a web browser, creating an e-mail, and changing computer settings.
Computers 2 focuses on using social media, Youtube, sending and receiving pictures, Microsoft Office (excluding Powerpoint), and typing practice.

Nuestros cursos básicos de sistemas de computadora se centran en las necesidades del estudiante. Ofrecemos los niveles 1 y 2 en función del tamaño de la clase y nivel de habilidad. Los profesores combinarán su conocimiento de la computadora y el amor de la enseñanza para crear un ambiente de clase que proporciona a los estudiantes con practica para una variedad de intereses y habilidades.


Computadoras Nivel 1 se centra en las instrucciones basicas para operar una PC - utilizar el ratón, escribir, navegar por un navegador web, la creación de un e-mail, y el cambio de la configuración del equipo.

Computadoras 2 se centra en el uso de las redes sociales, You Tube, enviar y recibir imágenes, Microsoft Office (excluyendo PowerPoint), y práctica del teclado.
