results.description:
PASSIVE HOUSE 101 - NYC CLIMATE WEEK EDITION!!!

Are you newly interested in the Passive House concept and wanting to learn more? Please join New York Passive House to find out what the Passive House standard entails. Ken Levenson, NYPH President will present the basics of Passive House design and showcase typical sustainable strategies used to achieve substantial energy savings.


Join us at RAB Lighting, 535 W 24th Street New York, NY 10001

As always, NYPH  Professional & Manufacturer members can attend for FREE. Not yet a member? Join here and get access to all member benefits including: 

FREE Access to Events
FREE Publicity for your Company/Organization in our Directories
Passipedia Access
Passive+ Magazine Online Access
Exclusive Member Meetings/Networking Opportunities
Discounts to Events Like the Annual NYPH Conference & Expo

AIA CREDIT: 1 AIA CES credit is offered. 

DESCRIPTION:

Passive House 101: An Introduction is a presentation that outlines the Passive House standard concepts and ongoing development.  It addresses organizing principles including predictability and comfort.  Materials, systems, details and energy modeling are presented - walking you through the methodology in a straight-forward manner.  The design and construction process is examined in terms of Passive House goals and qualities - from airtightness to thermal-bridge free connections.  From single family homes to skyscrapers, you’ll have a comprehensive introductory understanding of what it means to design, make and occupy a Passive House.     


SPEAKER
Ken Levenson
Partner, 475 High Performance Building Supply (475) & President of NY Passive House

Ken is an architect with over 20 years experience, a Certified Passive House Designer, a founding board member of the North American Passive House Network and of New York Passive House. Observing the gap between high performance buildings and the US building supply industry, Ken took on the task of establishing 475. The company supplies the US market with carefully selected products that focus on what matters most in high-performance, ecological, low-energy construction.
results.name: CLIMATE WEEK - Passive House 101, Introduction to Passive House with AIA credits

What is a hackathon and why should you, as a designer, attend? In this scintillating talk, veteran hackathoner, Emily Duong, will explain the ins-and-outs of what goes on at a hackathon and how attending them can help you improve as a designer. She'll go over strategies, expectations, and the skill sets needed to lead your team to the promised land of big money prizes and ephemeral glory. Join Emily as she presents case studies of her past experiences and winning entries. Come for the confidence to attend your first hackathon, stay for the extraordinary company and food.

THE SPEAKER

Emily Duong is the former art director of DailyBurn, where she led the design team in everything from branding to cake toppers to UI design for Xbox apps. Her hackathon team, aptly named by mortal competitors "Dream Team Duong (DTD)", has placed in every hackathon attended. In her spare time, she enjoys the forbidden arts of papermaking.

results.description:
...and we're back!

It's been awhile since we've gathered in NYC to talk PostgreSQL, so instead of just one presentation, we're going to have two in one meetup, and still be out by 8:15 for some beverages.

Our first presentation will be given by Joshua D. Drake (aka "JD"), a longtime PostgreSQL contributor.  Joshua has come back east from his homestate of Washington to talk about the upcoming PostgreSQL 9.5 release, in his own words.  Below is a summary of Postgres(QL) in 10:

The Elephant continues to dominate and these are the 10 things you must know about it right now. We will discuss the features from 9.5 that you must have, features that are overlooked, external applications to make your life easier and the status of the community. This talk is an all encompassing love fest with technical status for the current and new community members but don't worry, I won't hold back. I will also speak about a few things the community still does stubbornly wrong.

We will announce our second presentation soon.

We are generously being hosted again by our friends at Gilt Groupe.  Please make sure you fill out your full name for building security.  We look forward to you kicking off the fall PostgreSQL meetups with us!
results.name: PostgreSQL 9.5 Release Preview...and more!

results.description:
This presentation is a case study of how we built a Solr-driven search-based portal for Harvard Business School (HBS) Alumni, and buoyed by this successful implementation of Solr, how we are expanding its use to other areas of the Enterprise. You will hear about how choosing the Solr approach saved us a ton of custom development, and enabled us to offer end-users features such as personalization, faceted search and navigation of various types of content (e.g., people, events, alumni stories), autocomplete, and a geolocation mapping UI for navigating the people directory. In addition to a demo of the end-user UI, the talk will outline technical implementation details—these will include how we modeled the content in the database to work with Solr, developed a “search wrapper” to handle access control by brokering the requests/responses between the UI layer and Solr, and developed a custom Java loader to import content from our RDBMS into Solr. In short, this talk will describe the path we took in adopting Solr, speed bumps and potholes we hit along the way, where we are currently, and what the future roadmap looks like for using Solr in the HBS Enterprise. 

Bio: 


Ravi Mynampaty is just another search guy. He believes that making incremental changes is an effective path towards improving search and tries to make this happen on a daily basis. He is currently working on Enterprise Search at HBS, which includes setting Enterprise Search strategy, design and implementation of findability standards, search tools, and search user interfaces. Ravi has masters degree in engineering from the University of Massachusetts and Brandeis University.

Food and drinks will be served.

Books will be given away.
results.name: How We Spiked the HBS water supply with Solr

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description: Come hang out and watch puppies play - what could be better? Socialization is THE most important thing you can do for your puppy. It will help him or her learn valuable social skills and to not be afraid of novel or potentially scary things he or she will have to encounter on a daily basis. Often, people think their puppies are fine because they seem to love everything already, and when problems occur later down the line, it's a much bigger issue than it would have been if addressed in puppyhood. Take a professional's advice... make sure you socialize your puppy! Zen Dog Training Owner and Behavior Consultant Alexis Toriello supervises all play dates, answers training and behavior questions, and discusses topics like proper socialization and appropriate play.
results.name: Puppy Playdate

results.description: The Little Garden is a beginners study group dedicated to recognizing our relationship with god through one another. Our format is structured to introduce and apply the principles and methods of A Course In Miracles in our daily lives. To uncover the principles, we study portions of the text. To apply them, we practice workbook lessons. Each week, we meditate using a workbook lesson, and then study a principle or a workbook lesson, alternating between text and lessons. We also invite students to speak on their experience with a lesson or principle, focusing on a Miracle or Miracles they have experienced. There is no fee to attend; however, a contribution to support the cost of the group is appreciated.
results.name: Little Garden Study Group

results.description:
Title: My Worst Mistakes in Performance Testing

Abstract: “Wow, did I mess that up!! As modern software engineers we know the value of learning from our failures. We also know that it’s better to learn from the failures and mistakes of others than necessarily repeating the same mistakes in our own work. Allow me then to share my own personal “adventures” in performance testing - failures with load test automation, scripting, architecture, requirements, planning and analysis. We’ll talk about testing efforts failled missteps, incorrect configurations, blind spots and false results. Mini case-studies in how NOT to do performance testing and the potential downsides to such errors in testing."

Speaker:


Mark Tomlinson is an independent performance engineering and software testing consultant with 22 yearsexperience.  With experience in the recent past working at Microsoft andHewlett-Packard, he now offers coaching, training and consulting to help customers adopt modern testing and engineering strategies, practices and behaviors for better performing technology systems.


Speaker Details:

Mark Tomlinson – Performance Sherpa, PerfBytes
Twitter: @mtomlins
Website: PerfBytes.com
Blog: MTomlins.blogspot.com
results.name: September Testers Meetup

results.description:
NeuroTechNYC is the NYC chapter of NeuroTechX, an international organization of designers, engineers, neuroscientists, hackers, and more. 

Next Wednesday, join us for a night of neurohacking! We'll be discussing potential projects to pursue on an ongoing basis, and get down and dirty with some hardware, code, and bio-signals. There will be EMG-powered robotic arms and brain waves galore. :D

We have a number of EEG and human-computer interface devices, including a bunch of OpenBCI boards, an Emotiv Insight, a few NeuroSky headsets, and a lots of other biosensors.

If you have your own neurotech devices, please bring them! Otherwise just bring your brain and the desire to create and collaborate!

There is an attendance fee of $10/person for food and drinks!
results.name: NeuroTechNYC Hack Night #3

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Mental Poisoning by H. Spencer Lewis.

The topic for this week's discussion is Afterword: Does Fear Enslave You?

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

Tortured souls. Human beings, whose self-confidence and peace of mind have been torn to shreds by invisible darts—the evil thoughts of others. Can envy, hate, and jealousy be projected through space from the mind of another? Do poisoned thoughts like mysterious rays reach through the ethereal realm to claim innocent victims? Will wishes and commands born in hate gather momentum and like an avalanche descend upon a helpless man or woman in a series of calamities? Must humanity remain at the mercy of evil influences created in the minds of the vicious? Millions each year are mentally poisoned—are you safe from this scourge? Mental Poisoning is the title of a book written by Dr. H. Spencer Lewis, which fearlessly discloses this psychological problem.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mental Poisoning: Does Fear Enslave You?

results.description:
A healthy mind and body is key to a successful, joyful and happy life. Learning to manage the mind, emotions, stress in today's world is a much needed life skill. Did you know our very own breath actually holds a secret to a healthy and happy existence? :) Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes! In this one hour workshop we will explore the connection between the breath, mind and body and learn a few breathing techniques to relax and rejuvenate. We will top it off with a guided meditation - no experience necessary :)

The workshop is also an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program that has benefited over 40 million people worldwide . Don't hesitate to ask for the upcoming program.

So come join us!
results.name: Happiness Inside Out

results.description:
Hello,

I am looking to find partners to do this very demanding 100 k or 60 mi backpacking trip next August.  While this trip does not involve much cumulative elevation gain to cross the pass in the middle, it is on very rough terrain and it includes crossing glacial streams.


However, the setting is unique as it is in a wonderful arctic glacier-edged valley surrounded by big walls.  In fact, it is a fjord that was recently vacated by glaciers and has been used by Inuit as a traditional route where glaciers line the edges of the valley.  While nothing of this magnitude can really be compared, I believe that it is a place similar to Yosemite in California with one notable difference: you replace the crowd with numerous glaciers.  In 2004 Outside Magazine voted the Auyuittuq Backpacking trip one of the top "Trips Of A Lifetime".


Without doubt, this is an amazing place with two thirds of the trip above the Arctic Circle.  Auyuittuq means "The Land That Never Melts" in Inuit and this National Park has two mountains very famous around the world that draw a few world-class climbers every year.  Mount Asgard consists of two flat-topped and cylindrical rock towers that may have seen in a James Bond movie (“A spy who loved me”) when a stuntman  performed a BASE jump, skiing off the mountain with a parachute for the opening sequence of the film (see the end of https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PzA5R9aSFCI).  Mount Thor features the greatest vertical drop in the world (i.e., 1,250 m or 4,101 ft), with the cliff overhanging at an average angle of 15 degrees from vertical.  To illustrate, climbing this cliff, visible for days during the trip, takes about 30 days on the most technical routes.

I did most of the south part in 2012 and ever since I have been wanting to go back to do the whole pass from north to south. A description of the south part can be seen at http://www.blackfeather.com/hike/hike_auyuittuqgetaway.htm.  Regarding what I am proposing, the whole trip from north to south, you can see a description at http://www.blackfeather.com/hike/hike_auyuittuqtraverse.htm. While all organized trips doing the whole trip are 2 weeks long (i.e., time away from the south), I would like to go there for three weeks to have about 18 days in the Park so there is plenty of time to explore and climb some non-technical summits such as Tete Blanche, Tyr and Battle.  The scenery is great from the valley but it got just amazing once you climb up a bit to see the Penny ice cap (i.e., 6,000 km2 or 2,300 sq mi), which is thought by scientists to be the last remains of the massive Laurentide Ice sheet that covered most of Canada and a large portion of northern USA during the last ice age.  In 2012, I scrambled to the end of the Niflheim glacier, which is very close to Thor, and the view just got incredible on the Ice cap such as Highway glacier.


My research is all done and I could coordinate many aspects. Next summer, the best dates to go, weather wise, would be from August the 8th until the 29th when the river levels are usually lower. At that time, the average temperature ranges between 4 and 10C or 39 and 50F.  This is an arctic trip that is reasonably affordable, safe and logistically manageable as you can get there with scheduled flights and the Park maintains emergency shelters approximately every 10 kilometers where communications with the outside world is possible twice a day to call for help and to get weather forecasts.  There are even a few food and gear caches if something really bad happen. If you want to do some research, you can start at
http://www.pc.gc.ca/eng/pn-np/nu/auyuittuq/index.aspx with the Visitor Information Package.


The main risk is the crossing of the numerous glacier-fed rivers and it is possible that few crossings may have to be done very early in the day like 4 am.  Regarding the polar bears, they are rarely entering the Park as they prefer to stay on the north coast of Baffin island.  This latest point explains why we start from the north so that our Inuit outfitter can make sure that it is safe before unloading the boat.  As well, once we get off the boat, we walk 5 km or 3 mi inland before camping and we carry bear bangers.


The required budget could be as follows:


1)  Approximately 300$ for the Park entry and two boat rides.

2) Accommodations costs can be avoided completely by camping in communities as hotels are, otherwise, very expensive.  This is what I am going to do.

3) A budget for an extra boat ride could be nice while in Qikitarjuuaq as icebergs, polar bears, narwhals (a.k.a. the unicorn of the sea by Jules Verne), walrus, belugas, orcas and bow whales can be seen.  FYI, this community is often called the iceberg capital of the world since it is facing Greenland and this is the coast that all Greenland icebergs follow before going down to melt in the Atlantic Ocean.

4) Lightweight dry food for 3 weeks.

5) The most expensive thing is the airfare.  For example, the return flight from Ottawa is approximately  3000$ Canadian (First Air and Canadian North fly, via Iqaluit, to Qikitarjuuaq, the departure community, as well as Pangnitung, the arriving community) but it is still a lot cheaper than other arctic trip as you don’t need to add the cost of a charter plane.  I also know some cheaper options provided that booking is done enough in advance.  If you are very interested and the airfare cost is the only issue, we could talk about this specifically.

As the packs would be very heavy (approximately 35 kg or 75 pounds), a few weather-bound days are to be expected and well-though planning for 3 weeks of autonomy respecting food and gears is critical, the composition of the group is very important.  It is therefore important that interested persons be able to do at least one short group activity over the next few months, most likely in the New York State’s Adirondacks, in order to make sure that participants are compatible, capable, well equipped and fit enough. 


I am experienced, well-organized, mature, tall and fit.  In addition to my personal gear, I have a very light 2 person winter tent that can stand the possible katabatic winds.

If others are interested, we could also bring some gears for glacier travel so some of us can go camping on the glacier at the foot of Asgard  (i.e., Turner glacier for 6 km or 4 mi one-way).  As well, climbing gears could be brought so some of us in order to climb Thor on the less technical routes (i.e., the “standard” route thru East Face/North Ridge which has 3 pitches of 5.7 near the top or, alternatively, the route over the South Ridge which is mostly four class with the last 300 m or 100 ft been fifth class with one short section of 5.8 or 5.9).


If you are interested, the next steps would be to participate into a group discussion on Skype at 6:45 pm (Eastern Time) on Wednesday September 23rd.  In order to participate in the call, please send me an e-mail ([masked]) with your skype id as well as your weight and height with a description of your relevant experience for this trip (backpacking or other similar trip) and whether the airfare is an issue.  If you are interested but can’t make it that evening, this is not a problem but please let me know and send me the above information as I will arrange another group discussion in the following week starting on September 28th. As needed, other discussions would be arranged.


Thanks

Stephen from Ottawa, Canada

++


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

What are the 15,000 microscopic lifeforms that live on the subway? How disgusting are the contaminants in the Gowanus? Can we use technology to stop the spread of flu? Join us for the Empiricist League’s sixteenth gathering, covering the many varieties of DNA and microbes in New York.  Taking place at Union Hall (702 Union St. in Park Slope, Brooklyn) on September 23rd.

Going Viral: Using the Internet to Track the Flu in NYC and Beyond
Rumi Chunara is an Assistant Professor at NYU, in Computer Science & Engineering and the Global Institute of Public Health. The overarching goal of her research is to improve our knowledge of how and why infectious and noncommunicable diseases spread in populations. In order to do this, she leans on her engineering background and harnesses novel tools to source information directly from individuals including point of care diagnostics, mobile phones and other Internet-enabled sensors and media. Dr. Chunara will speak to the Empiricist League about her recent work and its implications for the spread of flu and other illnesses in New York City.

Mapping the Subway’s DNA: Sharing Your Commute with 15,000 Other Lifeforms
Ebrahim Afshinnekoo is a project leader at PathoMap, launched in summer of 2013 by the Christopher Mason Lab at Weill Cornell Medical College. The project studied the microbiome and metagenome of the built environment of NYC, with special emphasis on the subway system. Mr. Afshinnekoo will speak to the Empiricist League about what PathoMap uncovered about about both the microbial and human diversity of New York City.

Enquête Gowanus: The Invisible Life in the Gowanus Canal
Ian Quate earned his Bachelor of Art and Design degree at North Carolina State University in 2006 and his Master of Landscape Architecture degree from the Rhode Island School of Design in 2011. He currently works with Nelson Byrd Woltz Landcape Architects and is the creative lead of Enquête Gowanus in partnership with Gowanus Canal Conservancy (GCC), and Ellen Jorgensen at GenSpace, a community biolab based in downtown Brooklyn. Mr. Quate will speak to the Empiricist League about the industrial contaminants, sewage, and pathogens that make the Gowanus Canal home.

http://www.empiricistleague.com/2015/08/17/september-23rd-2015-the-hidden-dna-of-nyc/

http://www.unionhallny.com/event/944991-empiricist-league-16-brooklyn/

Tickets:

https://www.ticketfly.com/purchase/event/944991

About tonight's show:

These days, it's normal for us to always be glued to our screens.

So how are they changing us, and how will they shape our future?

This hour, TED speakers explore our ambivalent relationships with our screens.


Tonight's show features 5 TEDtalks:

• Amber Case: Are Our Devices Turning Us Into A New Kind Of Human?

• Rana El Kaliouby: Will Our Screens Soon Be Able To Read Our Emotions?

• Dimitri Christakis: When It Comes To Kids, Is All Screen Time Equal?


• P.W. Singer: How Are Screens Changing The Face Of War?

• Chris Milk: What Happens When We Step Inside The Screen?

Approximate timeline for the night:


7pm - Arrival & mingling

7:15pm - Show starts

8:15pm - Show ends; Short moderated discussion breaking out into smaller discussion groups.


Directions  & Parking:

The coffee house we've graciously been offered as a venue is located inside the Union Train station, near Kean University. It's in an unmarked building, so it might be tough to spot from a distance. To help you find it, here's what it looks like from down the street.

In addition, here is an overhead map to help you get your bearings and familiarize yourself with the area.

If you're driving to the event, you can park in any open spot at no charge. At this hour, there is no parking enforcement.

If you are taking the train, the venue is right inside the Union Train station, which is on the Raritan Valley Line. Here's an NJ Transit Map of the rail system to help you figure out if taking the train would be convenient for you.


To Find Us:

Please support the venue, Rock'n' Joe with a food or drink purchase (their coffee is sooo good!) so they can continue to welcome us back month after month!

On Wednesday, September 2nd, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The September session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (September 2nd - 23rd):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

results.description:
* Go Big or Go Home: Massive Numbers in Haskell, 7pm

* Parallel Computation of Cryptographic Hash Functions, 8pm


Go Big or Go Home: Massive Numbers in Haskell, 7pm
by Fred Schneider

Googol ... Googolplex ... Googolplexplex
This talk focuses on "Canon," a Haskell library designed to represent massive numbers such as the above and to as efficiently (as possible) perform computations with them. It will cover the features and limitations of this new library, as well as the quick wins and frustrations encountered while developing it. Additionally, it will cover some of the  math behind factoring numbers with algebraic forms (e.g. cyclotomic polynomials, Aurifeuillean factorization, and soforth).

Parallel Computation of Cryptographic Hash Functions, 8pm
by Prasad Rao (work with Stuart Haber)

This talk is an exploration of some work in progress that resulted  from an attempt to answer these questions: 1) How to arrive at a multicore reference implementation of the Sakura tree hash mode? 2) How to enable communication of "shape" between the entity that computes a cryptographic tree hash with the verifier of this hash? 3) How well does this reference implementation scale w.r.t. the number of cores, sizes of inputs, and variety of shapes?  4) How to do all this without becoming an expert on C++ parallel    programming?

This talk will be introductory and self-contained.  All we require of  the audience is willingness and ability to read Haskell code.

Extended Technical Notes:

Wikipedia defines a cryptographic hash function as a hash function which is effectively impossible to invert, that is, to recreate the input data from its hash value alone. These functions have been called "the workhorses of modern cryptography" and have many information security applications, notably in digital signatures, message authentication codes (MACs), and other forms of authentication of messages. 

The ideal cryptographic hash function has four main properties: 1) it is easy to compute the hash value for any given input, 2) it is infeasible to generate a input from its hash value, 3) it is infeasible to modify a input without changing its hash value, and 4) it is infeasible to find two different inputs with the same hash value.


The NIST announced a public competition in November 2007 to develop a new cryptographic hash algorithm, called SHA-3, for standardization. NIST announced Keccak as the winner of the SHA-3 Cryptographic Hash Algorithm Competition on October 2, 2012, and ended the five-year competition. The authors of Keccak also proposed a flexible, fairly general, encoding for tree hash modes, in order to enable the possibility to cleanly carry out sub-computations in parallel. Their "Sakura" encoding specifies how to use a standard cryptographic hash function on suitably divided portions of a long input message and combine the outputs so obtained in order to arrive at a single hash value enjoying the four properties listed above. The authors did not specify the mode by which the computer of the hash value communicates the "shape" in which these sub-computations are organized to verifiers of the hash. We designed a Domain Specific Language in Haskell in order to do this in a compact, understandable manner.
results.name: Massive Numbers in Haskell *and* Parallel Computation of Hash Functions

results.description:
Dr. Svante Paabo, of the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology in Leipzig, tells the story of his mission to answer the question of what we can learn from the genes of our closest evolutionary relative, culminating with his sequencing of the Neanderthal genome in 2009. We learn that Neanderthal genes offer a unique window into the lives of our hominim relatives and may hold the key to unlocking the mystery of why humans survived while Neanderthals disappeared as a distinct race of people. Drawing on genetic and fossil clues, Paabo explores what is known about the origin of modern human beings and their relationship to the Neanderthals and describes the fiery debate surrounding the nature of the two species interactions.It turns out that each of us carries 1 to 4 percent Neanderthal ancestry in our DNA, and that about 20 percent of the Neanderthal genome is preserved in ours overall — a rather intimate stranger indeed.  And then there is another cousin, Denisovan Man and Woman.  It gets more interesting every day. We we born at the right time to see marvels.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE.

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD: "Neanderthal Man: In Search of Lost Genomes"

This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.

Steve

7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
As seen on NY1 News and more! This is a singles gaming trivia Meetup. You are partnered into teams of 3-5 and get to work as a team to answer trivia questions. 

*THIS MEETUP SELLS OUT EVERY TIME, SO IF YOU LIKE TO ATTEND RSVP & GET TICKETS ASAP, ESPECIALLY WOMEN -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Sep-23-2015_at_0700PM

Trivia is a perfect "non-pressure" activity where you can gauge as to how smart, attractive, creative and collaborative your "teammates" are and perhaps find a potential future "mate". 

The winning team each round receives a FREE round of shots! After each round, we'll switch up teams so you get to meet the majority of singles in attendance.

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers

• All-Night Drink Specials

• Free round of shots for the winning team after each round

• Overall men & women's trivia champ receives a free round

 *50% off tix for group members ($15 - regular price $30)

*MUST PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Sep-23-2015_at_0700PM

RSVPing alone will not get you into this event. You must also purchase a ticket in advance.  (Tickets will NOT be sold at door).

This non-ethnic specific and will be mostly 20s-40s. 

Multiple Meetup groups are promoting this event so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. We'll have up to 50 members attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Sep-23-2015_at_0700PM

results.description:
NEW DATE SCHEDULED FOR WEDNESDAY - We'll return to Tuesdays after this exception.

As I'm sure you know, drones are pretty much everywhere now. They're being used in almost every industry for uses spanning agricultural data collection, ambulatory services, and package delivery (and the list, of course, goes on).

Here's the thing though...

What happens when there are too many drones in the sky?

And they start hitting each other? And falling on our heads?

Not a pretty thought.

Which is why big names (and I mean BIG. Google. NASA. Amazon.) have been meeting to develop a tracking and collision-detection system for drones, whether commercial or recreational. 

The Goal For This Think Tank

The end goal of this think tank is two-fold: 

First, we should be up to date on the current legislation so we can have an informed discussion. When we leave, we should be up to speed on what's happening in the industry so our discussions and any followup groups can hit the ground running. I recommend starting with this quick article:

https://www.rt.com/usa/310705-drone-air-traffic-control/


Second, let's talk about tipping the current timeline on its head. NASA's "short term" goal is to have this system ready within the next five years.

Five. Years. Five.

FIVE YEARS?!!

And even then, they say it will still be ten to fifteen years until it would actually allow for scaled use of the program.

That's ridiculous. 

So let's talk about versions of a system that could utilize crowdsourced information, AI, and other technology to make this happen within 2 years. That's our line in the sand.

Let's do it!!

See you there!

-Dan

Special thanks to Breather for an awesome meeting room!

Exclusive Breather Benefit for XPRIZE Member Groups & Meetups 

The Think Tank is proud to partner with Breather for our amazing venue space!

Breather offers over 96 beautifully-designed private and productive office spaces throughout New York City, San Francisco and Boston, starting for as low as $15 an hour. Whether you're on-the-go meeting with clients and potential partners, need a space for a group meeting and a coffee shop won't do, Breather spaces are the perfect solution when you need a quiet place to work, meet, relax or recharge. 

As a special perk for being an XPRIZE member, you get 1 free hour to try Breather. Simply download the app and use the promo codeXPRIZE to try it out for free, or visit http://brt.hr/XPRIZE.

EVERY Wednesday Night!

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

http://inspiredwordnyc.com

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. 

Details about the run

Route: As the sun is setting earlier now, we’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
LAUGHING FOR ANIMALS: A COMEDY SHOWCASE TO BENEFIT WOODSTOCK FARM SANCTUARY is an event open to the public organized by Only Connect: Aligning for Animals, a fresh concept created by Nell Alk. 

A comedy showcase to raise awareness, raise money and raise the roof, the evening will entail performances by headlining comedian Myq Kaplan, opening comedienne Kate Wolff and MC Alex Carabaño. Anticipate crave-worthy comfort food from vegan chef Jay Astafa, reds and whites from Whitecliff Wines, and dessert courtesy of Dun-Well Doughnuts. Also look forward to great gift bags, fantastic (and plentiful) raffle prizes and photo ops on the red carpet. Expect to rub elbows with WOODSTOCK FARM SANCTUARY co-founders Jenny Brown and Doug Abel, and say hello to the brains behind EXHIBIT C., Daphne Cheng.

• All are welcome, vegan and non-vegan alike! We don't bite! 

• Please note that 100% of funds raised through ticket sales will go directly to Woodstock Farm Sanctuary. And all but $30 of every ticket is tax deductible, too! 

• Recommended attire is cocktail casual. 

FACEBOOK EVENT PAGE: <a>http://bit.ly/invitingforanimals </a>

A BIT OF BACKGROUND 

Woodstock Farm Sanctuary recently relocated from Willow, New York, to High Falls, New York. The new property boasts a sprawling 150 acres, enabling Jenny and Doug to rescue that many more cows, chickens, pigs, goats, sheep, ducks, geese and rabbits from situations of abuse and neglect. This also allows for expanded programming, from kids' summer camps to vegan yoga retreats. The Sanctuary relocation also gives it closer proximity to New York City. But a lot of funds are needed to pay for the property and ongoing operations. That's where you come in! 

NOTE

For those unable to make it on Wednesday September 23, for whatever reason, please know that your contribution to Woodstock Farm Sanctuary is, regardless, greatly appreciated, much as we'll miss your presence at the party. Feel free to give what makes sense to you at http://bit.ly/fundraisingforanimals. 


ABOUT THE ENTERTAINMENT

Myq Kaplan
Myq Kaplan is a comedian named Mike Kaplan. He has appeared on The Tonight Show, Letterman, Conan, Last Comic Standing, his own half-hour Comedy Central special, a one-hour Netflix special, and the current season of America's Got Talent. His debut album, Vegan Mind Meld, was one of the top ten iTunes comedy albums of the year. His podcast, Hang Out With Me, is on the Keith and The Girl network. So many more things are true. Check out myqkaplan.com for more info, and enjoy your life please if you like. 

Kate Wolff
Kate Wolff is a standup comedian who has appeared on Tru TV's hit TV series "World's Dumbest," The Bethenny Show on FOX, and NickMom's "Night Out" on Nickelodeon. She performs almost every night at clubs throughout Manhattan and is a regular at New York Comedy Club, Broadway Comedy Club, Stand Up New York, and Greenwich Comedy Club. She has performed at the Laughing Skull Festival and Boston Comedy Festival.

Alex Carabaño
Brooklyn native Alex Carabaño is pretty busy these days. Not only does he co-run the V Spot and VSPOT Organic, both Latin-themed vegan eateries, but also he is one of the most sought-after comedians in the city. Alex is quickly on the rise with his humor about growing up playing soccer with Jamaicans, his veggie diet in a Colombian family, and working in the restaurant business. Alex's talents have landed him on BET, CBS and SiriusXM Radio. 

ABOUT THE VENUE

EXHIBIT C. is a fresh, organic space celebrating all that is food in the world. We blend food, wellness, entrepreneurship, art and tech to create deliciously interesting classes, dinners and events. Founded by haute vegetable chef Daphne Cheng, the space offers a platform for local and visiting chefs and entrepreneurs to showcase their talents and reach new fans. 

SPECIAL THANKS 

Special thanks is due to Raven + Crow Studio, Jay Astafa Catering, EXHIBIT C., Dun-Well Doughnuts and The Seed. 

SPONSORS 

Sponsorship for this event came in the form of both monetary and product donations from various individuals and entities. While some monetary sponsors prefer not to be named, four we'd like to highlight are Naturade VeganSmart, WayFare Foods, The Seed Experience and Speakeasy Dollhouse. 

Product donors for gift bags and raffle prizes include but are not limited to: 

22 Days Nutrition • Bee Free Honee • Brave GentleMan • Brooklyn Dark • Bulldog Skincare for Men • Candle 79 • Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret • Dan Witz • Field Roast • Gardein • Haymaker's Corner Store • Hurraw! Balm • India & Purry Designs • John Bartlett • LUSH • Main Street Vegan • Miyoko's Kitchen • Modern Minerals • Nicobella Organics • Produce Candles • Ruby Roth • Smarties • S.W. Basics • Vegan Publishers • Will Travel For Vegan Food
results.name: Laughing for Animals: A Comedy Showcase to Benefit Woodstock Farm Sanctuary

results.description:
Dr. Svante Paabo, of the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology in Leipzig, tells the story of his mission to answer the question of what we can learn from the genes of our closest evolutionary relative, culminating with his sequencing of the Neanderthal genome in 2009. We learn that Neanderthal genes offer a unique window into the lives of our hominim relatives and may hold the key to unlocking the mystery of why humans survived while Neanderthals disappeared as a distinct race of people. Drawing on genetic and fossil clues, Paabo explores what is known about the origin of modern human beings and their relationship to the Neanderthals and describes the fiery debate surrounding the nature of the two species interactions.It turns out that each of us carries 1 to 4 percent Neanderthal ancestry in our DNA, and that about 20 percent of the Neanderthal genome is preserved in ours overall — a rather intimate stranger indeed.  And then there is another cousin, Denisovan Man and Woman.  It gets more interesting every day. We we born at the right time to see marvels.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE.

(But put something on the bar beside your elbow.)
results.name: SHSNY Great Lectures on DVD - "Neanderthal Man: In Search of Lost Genomes"

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!

As seen on NY1 News and more! This is a singles gaming trivia Meetup. You are partnered into teams of 3-5 and get to work as a team to answer trivia questions. 

*THIS MEETUP SELLS OUT EVERY TIME, SO IF YOU LIKE TO ATTEND RSVP & GET TICKETS ASAP, ESPECIALLY WOMEN -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Sep-23-2015_at_0700PM

Trivia is a perfect "non-pressure" activity where you can gauge as to how smart, attractive, creative and collaborative your "teammates" are and perhaps find a potential future "mate". 

The winning team each round receives a FREE round of shots! After each round, we'll switch up teams so you get to meet the majority of singles in attendance.

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers

• All-Night Drink Specials

• Free round of shots for the winning team after each round

• Overall men & women's trivia champ receives a free round

This non-ethnic specific and will be mostly 20s-40s. 

Multiple Meetup groups are promoting this event so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. We'll have up to 50 members attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bots/dates/Sep-23-2015_at_0700PM

results.description:
At our inaugural Leadership Engagement Series Event, join us for wine & snacks with Tyler Gage, co-founder of RUNA. 


Tyler will speak about advancing your career through networking. RUNA supports sustainable livelihoods in the Amazon by brewing beverages from guayusa, a super-leaf packed with caffeine and antioxidants.

Tyler and his co-founder Dan MacCombie launched the company days after they graduated from college in 2009, and it has since grown into a multimillion-dollar business featured in the New York Times and Fast Company. Tyler, a Forbes 30 Under 30 honoree, will talk to TIES about the important role that networking played in the founding and growth of RUNA.

results.description:
**There have been almost 20 people in attendance since the class began two weeks ago.  Join anytime - we can give you previous weeks' handouts. 


The Bible Scholar Series is an exciting one-semester Bible study class that is taught on Wall Street in Manhattan. Amazing Christian and Jewish believers like you will gather to receive in-depth biblical and theological training. Those who complete this course will be equipped to actively fulfill the personal life calling that God has placed on their lives. This will truly be a life-changing course! Interfaith and irreligious learners are also warmly invited to enroll in this program, and they will find the curriculum enjoyable and informative. 

COMMITMENT LEVEL:


• This program will consist of a two-hour class that meets each week, with a total of 11 classes during the semester (for a total of 22 hours of class time). 

COST & RSVP

This is a FREE CLASS, just RSVP on Facebook to reserve your seat. 

AT A GLANCE:

• BIBLE KNOWLEDGE. To obtain a thorough understanding of the whole timeline of the Bible - from beginning to end. This will greatly increase you ability to see and explain God's great plan for world history.
• CULTURAL CONTEXT. To better understand the Jewishness and cultural context in which the Old and New Testaments were written. This will help you to see many important points that God was making that often elude those who do not understand the culture that the prophets, apostles, and other biblical figures lived in.
• FAITH-OUT-OF-THE-BOX. To develop your ability to clearly communicate the saving message of Jesus to others. You will even get equipped with several high-impact Bible verses that aid greatly in sharing the message.
• ANSWERS. To search for answers to many of the theological and philosophical questions you may have. This will strengthen your faith and confidence in talking about your faith, and it will help you to answer questions for your friends, family members, co-workers, etc.
• TRAINING TO TEACH. For those who may feel called teach the Bible in some capacity, whether in a formal or informal setting, this class will be a very helpful path of preparation.
• MENTORING/DISCIPLESHIP. Believers who develop in spiritual maturity should eventually be able to mentor new believers. This is an important part of spiritual growth. This course will prepare you to effectively train new believers in the Judeo-Christian faith.
• TRAINING IN LEADERSHIP. To ready yourself to lead or co-lead successful small group Bible studies.
• PREPPING FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS. To prepare yourself for high-impact world outreach and aid trips, for sharing the faith in unreached areas, and training spiritual leaders in third world nations
• AN ALTERNATIVE TO SEMINARY. To gain some of the important knowledge that you would gain in an accredited seminary degree in Theological and Biblical Studies - but without having to commit to a massive program.

More information and course descriptions on the <a>website</a>.
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor Conference Room.  Text 347-703-7800 if you need help.
results.name: Bible Scholar Series: A High-Growth Bible Study Class

results.description:
Join us for an ongoing weekly game of the new version of Dungeons & Dragons! Take on the role of a heroic fantasy adventurer as you travel the Forgotten Realms trying to uncover a plot by the evil Queen of Dragons!

NO previous experience is required to play! We will teach rules and provide characters if needed. Play once or twice or join us every week for an ongoing adventure played out over several months like a great fantasy TV series starring YOU!

Ages 13 and up are welcome, 12 and under if a parent is present during the game (you don't need to play, but can if you want!).

Admission is by Modern Myths event pass (a Day Pass is $5 you get back in store credit, and Monthly and Yearly options are available). Space at the tables can be limited, so show up early to make sure you get a seat.

DUNGEON MASTERS NEEDED! If you have an interest in leading games at the store, contact us! You'll qualify for goodies from WotC, free passes to store events, and a small weekly store credit for every session you run!

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Wednesday - Live Model Drawing - Union Square

results.description:
Gather around for some drinks and conversation on the 23rd of September on the 10th Floor of WeWork Charging Bull. The topic of discussion will be, "The State of Entrepreneurship."

For example, some of you might have read the recent article on Tech Crunch about, "the promise of 5g," or maybe you've seen the astonishing numbers regarding NY venture capital growth and how it's caught up to it's west coast peers. 

Maybe the JOBS Act and it's crowdfunding provision excites you or better yet maybe you're an 18-34 year old "millennial" who just wants to know how this new wave of entrepreneurship can help you make the right career moves or even startup plans. 

All of you are welcome and we hope to quench your thirst.
results.name: Discuss the "State of Entrepreneurship"

This Maptime we will see a demo of Turf.js, showing you how to better use it in your projects. Turf.js is a JavaScript library for spatial analysis. It includes traditional spatial operations, helper functions for creating GeoJSON data, and data classification and statistics tools.


As usual, we'll plan on spending around half an hour on a tutorial and will have around an hour free for questions, office hours, and working on projects.


Please bring a laptop and a project you're working on, if any.

results.description:
Join TheConsultantLounge for another great Networking Event in NYC on Wednesday, Sept 23rd from 6:30pm - 9:00pm EST at Poppin.

This event is part of our meetup series to create networking opportunities and advance relationships within the global management consulting community - all in a 'lounge-y' setting.

Our panel at this event will include leaders from a variety of Consulting firms; and rather than a panel discussion topic, the time will be used for audience Q&A, so get your 'burning' questions ready for our panelists - they are ready to share their personal insights, lessons and stories so we all can learn from. 

While our events are focused on consultants, we also welcome anyone interested in the profession including independent and ex-consultants, business professionals, entrepreneurs and students. Most of our events attract a mix of all of these groups. As always, food & drinks will be provided!

Speaking At This Event:

Marck Aghnatios is an Advisory Director in KPMG's Technology Enablement practice with more than 14 years of management consulting experience with a 'Big 4' firm. He has extensive experience managing long term, strategic and growth initiatives for Fortune 500 companies. Marck specializes in management consulting, business development, entrepreneurial leadership, business process management, technology and business integration and IT strategy. He recently also completed his Executive MBA NYU Stern with a focus on Organizational Leadership and Entrepreneurship.

Kyle Sarausky is a Manager in West Monroe Partners’ Private Equity practice. He has more than eight years of management consulting experience, blending deep transaction and technology expertise to advise global clients and Fortune 500 companies across many industries. Kyle is a recognized expert in merger and acquisition transactions and joined West Monroe Partners in 2014 from Ernst & Young. He began his career as a management consultant specializing in IT strategy and transformation with Accenture in New York.


Event Partners & Sponsors:

Change the way you work with Poppin's modern, cool office supplies that come in a variety of styles and colors. For more head here: http://www.poppin.com/   

Check out all our prior events here: http://theconsultantlounge.com/events/

If you have any questions or suggestions, please get in touch with us at: [masked] stay up to date with all our events visit:

www.theconsultantlounge.com

Also, check out and join our new LinkedIn group !
results.name: Consulting Networking Event - NYC

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Pre-Halloween Glamour Shoot w/Noel & Jenny - Sept. 23rd"


With the success of our last "dress-up" shoot, we are back with the first of our pre-halloween themed shoots. We have two amazing models, Jenny who was a big hit at the last shoot and first time modeling for us is beauty Noel.

About the Shoot:


With Halloween around the corner, we wanted to continue the "costume" theme but with a glamour twist. (We'll have more of a Halloween theme next month with props and working on a dry ice setup with some edgy lighting.) So, for this shoot the ladies will be dressed in sexy "costumes" with a lingerie/glamour styling. We've been lucky with the weather so far and if fortunate again, we'll do some outdoor shooting as the last days of summer wind down. Indoors, we'll continue with the pinup setups and glamour lighting.

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup.

Cost: $80

(Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge)

(Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.)

Models:

Noel Moore: MM#[masked] - Instagram

(Photos provided by model for promotional purposes only. All rights their respective owners.)


Jenny Barr: Instagram


(PhotoCredit: NandoPro)

One-on-Ones: The models will be available for half hour one on one shoots after the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

NEW Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

_______________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. So, at the very least give us 3 days notice that you will not be able to attend or in case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up past the 3 days notice, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup.

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels within the 3 days before the shoot, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes". Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

Bocce Rules: Goal of game= to get as many balls close to the palina (white ball)

1. Throw palina down at least ½ length of court.

2. Team one throws all their balls as close to palina as possible, but ball hitting wall doesn’t count. Or, Teams take turns throwing their balls.

3. Once all balls are thrown, closest color balls get points until next closest ball is a different color, and that stops point count for that round.

4. You can also try to hit palina closer to your balls, after putting all your color balls in a group on the court.

5. Balls that hit the wall on first throw are taken out of the court

results.description:
Synopsis:

Horacio Oliveira is an Argentinian writer who lives in Paris with his mistress, La Maga, surrounded by a loose-knit circle of bohemian friends who call themselves "the Club." A child's death and La Maga's disappearance put an end to his life of empty pleasures and intellectual acrobatics, and prompt Oliveira to return to Buenos Aires, where he works by turns as a salesman, a keeper of a circus cat which can truly count, and an attendant in an insane asylum. Hopscotch is the dazzling, freewheeling account of Oliveira's astonishing adventures.

About reading it:

Written in an episodic, snapshot manner, the novel has 155 chapters, the last 99 designated as "expendable." Some of these  "expendable" chapters fill in gaps that occur in the main storyline, while others add information about the characters or record the aesthetic or literary speculations of a writer named Morelli who makes a brief appearance in the narrative. Some of the "expendable" chapters at first seem like random musings, but upon closer inspection solve questions that arise during the reading of the first two parts of the book.

An author's note suggests that the book would best be read in one of two possible ways, either progressively from chapters 1 to 56 or by "hopscotching" through the entire set of 155 chapters according to a "Table of Instructions" designated by the author. Cortázar also leaves the reader the option of choosing a unique path through the narrative.

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
