results.description:
Tonight we have a special bellydance event with Rick Bogart Jazz Trio. Live music starts at 8, bellydancing starts at 9

Rick Bogart, (February 10, 1951 – ) is a jazz musician. Early in his career he played clarinet and piano, but he eventually focused solely on clarinet and later added vocals. He also composed throughout his career for clarinet.

Rick Bogart worked in New Orleans during the "heyday" of the French Quarter during the mid 1970s within the first five blocks of Bourbon Street. At that time, there were fifteen full-time Jazz bands along those blocks. During this time he played in the bands of Snookum Russell and Wallace Davenport at the Paddock Lounge, and with June Gardner, Nick Gagliardi, Milton Ziedrich and Thomas Jefferson at the Famous Door. Bogart later moved to New York City to refine and broaden his style. He played in Atlantic City, Cleveland, New York City, Miami, and touring the world headlining on cruise ships for decades. He has written songs for major movies produced for HBO and is the subject of the documentary When the Clarinet Swings. He is most closely aligned with his New Orleans and Swing-style background. However, he has broadened his style over the course of his career by living and working in New York, and working with many musicians of varying styles around the world. In the words of Danny Stiles of WNYC Radio, "One of the great clarinetists of our era."

Amayah Bellydancing: Amayah is a dancer who has learned both traditional middle eastern and more contemporary styles of belly dance. She currently lives and dances in New York City, performing as a resident dancer at Tagine Moroccan Restaurant in Midtown, and is also a member of Columbia Belly Dance at Columbia University, where she is a Masters student in the Clinical Psychology program. Amayah is of multiracial descent and grew up in the New York/New Jersey metro area, where she started dancing at a very young age. Beginning with ballet, modern, jazz, hip hop and even west african dance, she was drawn to belly dance when she started as a freshman in her undergraduate years at Rutgers. She auditioned and joined the Rutgers belly dance troupe in fall 2009, and the following year became their dance coach for the next three years, choreographing the troupe pieces. Amayah was primarily taught in American cabaret, modern Egyptian, classical Egyptian (raqs sharqi, raqs beledi, and raqs shaabi), and tribal fusion styles, but is always learning new styles and advancing her technique. She is very grateful to all of her amazing teachers who have influenced and inspired her over the years.

To book a table call[masked] www.taginedining.com
results.name: Jazz Night with Rick Bogart and Bellydancing by Amayah!

results.description:
Tonight we have a special bellydance event with Rick Bogart Jazz Trio. Live music starts at 8, bellydancing starts at 9

Rick Bogart, (February 10, 1951 – ) is a jazz musician. Early in his career he played clarinet and piano, but he eventually focused solely on clarinet and later added vocals. He also composed throughout his career for clarinet.

Rick Bogart worked in New Orleans during the "heyday" of the French Quarter during the mid 1970s within the first five blocks of Bourbon Street. At that time, there were fifteen full-time Jazz bands along those blocks. During this time he played in the bands of Snookum Russell and Wallace Davenport at the Paddock Lounge, and with June Gardner, Nick Gagliardi, Milton Ziedrich and Thomas Jefferson at the Famous Door. Bogart later moved to New York City to refine and broaden his style. He played in Atlantic City, Cleveland, New York City, Miami, and touring the world headlining on cruise ships for decades. He has written songs for major movies produced for HBO and is the subject of the documentary When the Clarinet Swings.


He is most closely aligned with his New Orleans and Swing-style background. However, he has broadened his style over the course of his career by living and working in New York, and working with many musicians of varying styles around the world. In the words of Danny Stiles of WNYC Radio, "One of the great clarinetists of our era."

Amayah Bellydancing: Amayah is a dancer who has learned both traditional middle eastern and more contemporary styles of belly dance. She currently lives and dances in New York City, performing as a resident dancer at Tagine Moroccan Restaurant in Midtown, and is also a member of Columbia Belly Dance at Columbia University, where she is a Masters student in the Clinical Psychology program. Amayah is of multiracial descent and grew up in the New York/New Jersey metro area, where she started dancing at a very young age. Beginning with ballet, modern, jazz, hip hop and even west african dance, she was drawn to belly dance when she started as a freshman in her undergraduate years at Rutgers. She auditioned and joined the Rutgers belly dance troupe in fall 2009, and the following year became their dance coach for the next three years, choreographing the troupe pieces. Amayah was primarily taught in American cabaret, modern Egyptian, classical Egyptian (raqs sharqi, raqs beledi, and raqs shaabi), and tribal fusion styles, but is always learning new styles and advancing her technique. She is very grateful to all of her amazing teachers who have influenced and inspired her over the years.

To book a table call[masked]
www.taginedining.com
results.name: Jazz Night with Rick Bogart and Bellydancing by Amayah!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Having trouble fully absorbing A Course in Miracles (ACIM) or another non-dualistic spiritual tradition? Then A COURSE OF LOVE may be just for you! Channeled by the same voice that authored ACIM but in more easy to understand language, Mari Perron's A COURSE OF LOVE speaks to the heart rather than the mind. Let's explore this important new text together and use it as a springboard to become peaceful miracle workers. 

Led by CRS co-founders and ACIM Teachers/Healers Yasuko Kasaki and Christopher Pelham, this class will begin at the beginning of the book and work its way through the text week by week, taking breaks whenever Yasuko is away teaching in Japan (usually November, March and July).

It may be astonishing to hear that there is a “continuation” of A Course in Miracles, but it is true. Forty years ago Jesus dictated ACIM to the scribe Helen Schucman. More recently, over three years, he similarly dictated A Course of Love. Jesus himself referred to what he was dictating as a “continuation of A Course in Miracles.” Students of ACIM will recognize the Voice. Students of truth, whatever their background, will find that ACOL resonates with the heart.

A COURSE OF LOVE builds upon the same non-dualistic thought system as ACIM, yet it is a course for the heart. ACOL and ACIM work hand-in-hand. Yet remarkably, ACOL bypasses the mind. It uses thought to go beyond thought. Those yearning to access the heart’s knowing will find help here. This is your invitation to live the purposeful, meaningful life of the new—the reality of heaven on earth.

Classes are $20 and class cards are available.
results.how_to_find_us: above Think Coffee (look for the brown door to the right/south of Think and ring the bottom buzzer)
results.name: Intro to A COURSE OF LOVE by Mari Perron

group.name: A Course in Miracles ongoing class

results.description:
Join us for a mixed levels mellow vinyasa yoga class.  With just the right amount of alignment cues and modifications this flow will be intuitive and appropriately challenging for all, whether you are a beginner or advanced practitioner.

The vinyasa style of yoga links the yoga poses (asanas) with the breath, focusing as much on the transitions from pose to pose, as on the actual poses.  This class starts with a mindful and centering warm-up, building into a moderately paced yoga flow and allowing for deeper stretches and longer holds toward the end of the class. By the final pose, savasana, your body and mind will feel totally prepared to melt into a blissful state of peace and relaxation.

Pricing: $10 per student.  

Please make an effort to arrive 5 to 15 minutes in advance of class and always RSVP (even if it's last moment).  If you need to be late, please walk-in and set up as quietly as you can.  Thank you.
results.name: Vinyasa Yoga (with Jeni)

results.description:
Forch of Nature Music Group proudly presents: "The Shed".

The Shed is a monthly jam session catering to New York City's hottest Hip Hop, Soul and Jazz musicians. The showcase is a platform for progressive music as well as a place for artist to build their chops. While occasionally heating the stage themselves, The Shed's hosts Anu~Sun, Augi and Bria Monèt will introduce you to some of New York's finest underground talent and surprise guests.

To learn more about The Shed, visit them on Instagram: www.instagram.com/theshedopenjam

Below is a music vibe example of The Shed house band when they were at Tammany Hall earlier this year, led by HarlemGo Meetup member Anu The Giant, however all genre of music is welcome to come share their talent.

http://youtu.be/Rg3PmE6dAAQ

Past Performances at #TheShed Include:

Robert Glasper, James Poysner (of The Roots), Mark Kelley (of The Roots), Raymond Angry (of The Roots), RC and The Gritz (Erykah Badu’s backing band), Big Yuki, Marcus Strickland, Jaleel Shaw, Jerimiah Abiah

Our Meetup

Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana at 9:00pm to hold seats for group members attending. Showtime starts around 9:30pm and goes to midnight. If you are interested in performing this evening, be sure to arrive early (between 9:30-10:00pm) and sign-up on the performing list at the venue. As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to reach him at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.
results.how_to_find_us: Downstairs at the tables along the wall (by the restroom)
results.name: Vibe with #TheShed - An Open Music Jam Session @ Silvana - Free to Attend!

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description:
Where: The NY Midtown Hilton, 6th Ave. at 53rd St. 
When: Thursday, Sept. 24th, 7:30am (you can come before work!) 
Why: We can transition New York off coal for good, and invest in renewables instead—but we need EVERYONE'S help! 

RSVP here 
Facebook event here - share with all your Facebook friends! 

On Thursday, Sept. 24th, all of Governor Cuomo's top energy officials will be at the New York Midtown Hilton for a conference on Reforming the Energy Vision (REV), New York's big plan to make the state grid cleaner and more distributed. 

Yes, you heard that right: all of New York's top energy officials - on the very same day Pope Francis arrives in town. 

What better time to channel the Pope's climate leadership, and take tangible, local action on climate? So we're gonna be there to make sure that while they're touting clean energy with one hand, they're not bailing out coal with the other. From offshore wind power along the coast to distributed solar technology in our communities, we know that New York can make the transition – it’s on us to make sure that this transition is just, ambitious, and accountable to the public.

RSVP HERE for the morning rally, and tell New York's top energy officials to quit coal for good and invest in renewables! We'll provide coffee and bagels, so you can start your day off with some real climate action, and be done in time for the workday. Couldn’t be easier, couldn’t be more important. Would really love to see you all there!

RSVP here 
Facebook event here - share with all your Facebook friends!

Dan Sherrell 
Sierra Club 
NYC Organizing Representative
[masked]
results.name: Morning Rally For A Real Energy Vision - Renewables, Not Coal Bailouts!

Most Thursdays (except when there is a holiday) from 8:15-10AM we conduct our networking and business development meetings for salespeople, consultants, entrepreneurs and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) (I will bring the bagels.)

Schedule for 2015 @AXA: 8:15-10AM
Thursdays @AXA, Citrin Cooperman and Ainsworth Park

September 10 & Lunch, 17 & Happy Hr, 24 & Lunch

October 8 & Lunch, 15 & Happy Hr, 22 & Lunch

November 12 & Lunch, 19 & Happy Hr, 26 is Thanksgiving

December 10 & Lunch, 17 & Happy Hr, 24 & Lunch

We are much more than your average networking group. We act as your own private business advisory council. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

What is a breakfast business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out...

AXA Advisors is located at: 1290 Ave of the Americas (bet 51 - 52nd St.)
16th floor (Always check with security)

Please email or call Raphi Salem if you are interested in joining.

results.description:
September: A Time for New Beginnings. Are YOU ready?
So many of us view post-Labor Day as the “new year,” whether or not we have kids returning to school.

Let’s use this seventh-inning calendar reset to regroup and challenge ourselves! What was it you were hoping to accomplish when the real calendar turned to 2015 last January? Expand your business? Pare down your client list to the ones that matter? Enhance your LinkedIn profile? Update your web site? Create a new logo? Launch a blog? Just figure out what skill you have and love that could be marketable? Well, it’s time! Why don’t you attend the September 24 Summit/New Providence B.I.G. (Believe, Inspire, Grow) meeting from 10-11:30 at Twin Maples in Summit.


We will be discussion blogging…how to get started, how often you should blog, what you should say etc. The group that gathers is a friendly, non-intimidating crew. And quite diverse too…plenty of our members have thriving businesses, but others are just starting out. Their fields range from health/nutrition, business coaching, fitness, direct sales, jewelry design, interior design, realty, insurance, banking, legal, web design/graphics, baking, software development, tutoring/education, you name it…we have it!

Maybe the time is right for you to take the plunge?
results.name: Why do you need to blog for your business?  Come to BIG in Summit and learn why.

results.description:
Nikon is one of the most recognized brands in the photography industry and their commitment to innovative cameras places them as an industry leader. Come by the store to learn more about Nikon's latest camera offerings and how they are right for you.

Come meet Nikon tech rep Alex Podstawski and get all of your Nikon technical questions answered in-store from 10 AM – 3 PM.

Check out the Nikon showcase here. 

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography: Alex Podstawski has been working as a Nikon Technical Representative since early 2012.  At age 13 he began shooting on his first camera, a Nikon FE and has been working with light and cameras ever since.  Working in the photo industry since age 16 and shooting weddings only two years later, Alex has gained experience uncommon for someone his age.  His specialties include infrared and ultraviolet photography, portrait, landscape, wedding, event, wireless flash, and auto racing, among others.  With years of experience working in photo labs and specialty stores, as well as a diverse professional career, Alex is eager share his knowledge and enthusiasm for photography at every opportunity. 


http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/AlexPodstawski_HEAD.jpg?itok=SI_wsyo4
results.name: VENDOR DAY: Nikon

results.description:
Celebrate Climate Week NYC by seeing Passive House construction happening hands-on!


Swing by the Passive House Tradesperson Training for this FREE Climate Week exclusive event, hosted by NYPH, the Passive House Academy (PHA)</a>, and <a href="http://aea.us.org/">the Association for Energy Affordability (AEA)<a href="http://aea.us.org/"></a>. 

The best way to learn is through experience, so put your Passive House theories to test by seeing Passive House construction happen right before your eyes.  Attendees will have the opportunity to see how Passive House air barriers are properly installed on props, as well as the opportunity to witness a blower door demonstration. 

About the Instructor:


Kevin Brennan is a building science consultant and trainer and the New York-based representative for the Passive House Academy (PHA). He is a Certified Passive House Tradesperson and holds a variety of certifications from BPI and ABAA. Kevin teaches PHA's hands-on courses for retrofit installers and Passive House Tradesperson courses leading to BPI, ABAA and PHI certifications. Most recently, Kevin worked on  NYC's first historic certified EnerPhit project, for which Kevin  led the AEA team implementing all Passive House details.
results.name: CLIMATE WEEK - Passive House Tradesperson Open House

group.name: NY Passive House (NYPH) Meetup: New York City

results.description:
Lions Vision Productions, Worthy Women's seminar series, "The Woman & Her Business",  provides entrepreneurial and personal development seminars to women entrepreneurs and those aspiring.  

Additionally, we produce an online seminar series for woman in transition through our, Worthy Women's Empowerment Academy. To view a FREE seminar, topic Break the Chains (free yourself from anything standing in the way if your success) go here now http://www.lvpnj.com/subscribe.html

The seminar series provides practical education, tools, tips, resources and support to help women in their process of being successful entrepreneurs while maintaining balance in their other important roles. 

"The Woman & Her Business" series models a wholistic approach to developing and empowering women.  Seminar topics range to cover those most often creating barriers in personal growth, as well as, establishing, maintaining and expanding businesses. 

The seminar series is hosted by Lions Vision Productions Founder & Executive Producer, LaTia McNeely-Sandiford, MSW.  LaTia is also a published author, (Burdens in My Backpack), Inspirational Speaker, Success Coach and Union County New Jersey's 2014 Woman of Excellence for Entrepreneurship. For more information about LaTia visit http://www.mslatia.com.

Lions Vision Productions is a New Jersey based multi-media production company that specializes in event production/decor, women's entrepreneurial & empowerment initiatives and non-fiction media. 

For more information on Lions Vision Productions, the Worthy Women's Entrepreneurial Network/Seminar Series, upcoming events or registration visit http://www.lvpnj.com/worthy-womens-2015-seminars.html

results.description:
Whether you are a portrait, wedding or product photographer, learning the basics of flash will allow you to always get the shot for your clients. Beyond the basics of hard/soft, specular/diffused and shaping of your source, a professional should have a few of these advanced techniques in their toolbox.


Join Daniel Norton On Set as he shows you the how, when and why to use techniques such as rear curtain sync, multi-pop and sequential flash.


Learn: The difference between High Speed Sync and Flash Duration.


Learn: How to add life to your images with Pop and Blur.

Learn: How to get tack sharp splashes.

Demos start at 12:00, 2:00 and 4:00pm


Each session will be unique, Come for one or all!
results.name: FREE DEMO! OnSet: Mastering Flash; Advanced Techniques

results.description:
Skip McLaughlin will conduct a Professional Enrichment Seminar for the NYIT School of Management

Skip is an Entrepreneur, Executive, and Author. Founder of four B2B businesses. Investor in start-ups and real estate. Executive with Johnson Controls and Partner at Trammell Crow Company. Regional Marketing Manager at Hewlett-Packard and salesman for IBM. Founded real estate services company United Systems Integrators Corporation (USI) in 1991, grew USI into an Inc 500 Company and sold it to a Fortune 100 company, Johnson Controls in 2005. Became CEO of JCI's Global Workplace Business for the Americas from 2005 to 2007. Honored by Ernst and Young as Entrepreneur of the Year for Business Outsourcing in 2001.Having bootstrapped four companies, Skip will be releasing a new book: "The Purpose Is Profit: Secrets of a Successful Entrepreneur From Startup to Exit."

All attendees will receive the Startup Roadmap Booklet

Location 1: Room 704, Edward Guilliano Global Center, 1855 Broadway, New York, NY 1002

Location 2: DL3, Harry J. Shure Hall, NYIT, Old Westbury, Long Island

Event will be live-streamed to additional NYIT campus: Old Westbury, Long Island

results.description:
FIELD TRIP: Fulton Center, Trinity Church & Brooklyn Bridge, 9/24/15, 3:30PM

Let's take a walking and shooting tour of the City Hall/Wall Street area.   We'll first meet at the new Fulton Center subway station which connects the 2 3 4 5 A C J N R Z services via an east-west underground passageway and features a newly completed high-visibility Transit Center with entrances on Broadway between Fulton Street and John Street.  We'll meet inside the station so if you're arriving by subway, do not exit the turnstile or you will have to pay another fare!  The newly completed center is quite futuristic in design with plenty of light for us photographers.  Many great images abound.  Next, we'll walk over to photograph at Trinity Church, an Episcopal church where Alexander Hamilton (a Revolutionary soldier and founding father) and his wife and Robert Fulton (inventor of the steamboat) are buried here.  The iconic Brooklyn Bridge will be our last subject.  Sunset is at 6:48 PM so we'll get wonderful sunset shots as we traverse the bridge.   We'll meet up on the Brooklyn side for an optional and dutch meal and beverages. 


Please RSVP at right.


For more info, see:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fulton_Center

http://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/10/nyregion/fulton-center-a-subway-complex-reopens-in-lower-manhattan.html?_r=0

https://www.trinitywallstreet.org

http://www.tripadvisor.com/Guide-g60763-i426-New_York_City_New_York.html

There is no charge for this event!
results.how_to_find_us: Group of Photographers!
results.name: FIELD TRIP: FULTON  CENTER, TRINITY CHURCH & BROOKLYN BRIDGE 9/24/15, 3:30 PM

Comic time! Reading the IDW My Little Pony comic book series aloud together is a lot of fun. Come try it with us! 


This week:  Vines vines vines!


So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friendship is Magic #27 - 28 - The Root of the Problem (descriptions and download links below)

Friendship is Magic #27

Timberwolves invade Ponyville! They're just the start of the troubles for our ponies though as many other mystical creatures emerge from Everfree Forest. What could be causing the mass migration and how can the balance of nature be restored?

Written by: Katie Cook
Artwork by: Tony Fleecs, Andy Price

Download link: https://goo.gl/5Er5Bz

Friendship is Magic #28
Twilight and friends journey to the heart of Everfree Forest to find out what has been causing its inhabitants to flee. What they find can only mean trouble for Ponyville!


Written by: Katie Cook
Artwork by:  Andy Price, Sarah Richard

Download link: https://goo.gl/ndNnFy

******************************************************

The Central Park Chess + Checkers House Visitors Center is easy to find, it is located on top of a hill just North of the Victorian Gardens Amusement Park, just East of the Carousel, and just West of The Dairy.

*************************************************************

Comic Readings Schedule (subject to change)

June 10th - MLP: Friendship is Magic # 25-26 The Good, the Bad and the Ponies
June 29th - MLP: Friendship is Magic # 27-28 The Root of the Problem

results.description:
Join 350NYC and thousands of others concerned about climate justice at three important, back-to-back events on September 24, the eve of Pope Francis's address to the UN General Assembly. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE: The 350NYC contingent will gather on the NE corner of 2nd Ave. and 47th St., just before 4:30 and just before 6:00, so that we can be present as a group for the two events at Dag Hammarskjöld Plaza.

-------------------------------------------------------------------
The first two events will be at Dag Hammarskjöld Plaza, E. 47 St. between 1 Ave. and 2 Ave., and are open to all.  

• "Light the Way" - a multifaith ceremony and prayer service to show support for the Pope's call to heed both "the cry of the Earth and the cry of the poor," featuring song, prayer, ritual, and participants from many spiritual traditions. 4:30-5:30pm; Facebook link here.

• "Under One Sky" - a civil society rally to increase public awareness, garner media attention, and mobilize here and around the world to push for ambitious plans to fight poverty, inequality, and climate change. 6:00-7:45pm; Facebook link here.

These will be followed by an all-night multifaith prayer vigil at the nearby Church of Our Savior, Park Ave. at 38th Street, beginning at 8:00pm and culminating the next morning with a symbolic procession taking a Light to the UN for the Pope's address to the General Assembly. Register here for the vigil (required).

350NYC participants will gather as a group on the NE corner of 2nd Ave. and 47th St., just before each of the events at Dag Hammarskjöld Plaza - join us!
results.name: NYC Rallies for Climate Justice - now 3 events

results.description:
Join DM Kyle Wagenblast as he recreates the classic D&D 2E module "Adam's Wrath" by Lisa Smedman. This is an adventure in the Ravenloft setting, updated to D&D 5E, and is for characters of 5th level.

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.
results.name: D&D 5E: Ravenloft - Adam's Wrath

results.description:
Going to try and make this weekly until the snow comes:

Any one interested in some speed (track) workout during the week? I usually try and get to Berkeley Heights high school once a week. Dates flexible if more interested.


My plan is to do some 800m repeats at my 10k race goal pace.  Workout will look like this:

10-15 minute warmup with dynamic movement

10 min core work

6 x 800m at 10k pace.  2 min recovery between rep

10 min cool down

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could happen as you willingly run across rough terrain with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/
results.name: Berkeley Heights Track Workout- Round 2

results.description:
Wondering how to understand social media ROI? Looking to leverage content marketing? This upcoming #DFMeetup will feature local Toronto fashion and retail digital executives and tech startups sharing their advice, stories, and opinions on their most successful engagement strategies.

This is event is perfect for anyone looking to learn engagement strategies from leaders in the local community. You don't have to be in fashion to take advantage of the learnings.


Industry chat with:  

Roots Canada: James Connell, VP E-Commerce & Marketing
Roots Canada is a leader in leveraging social shopping in their online marketing strategy. Highlighting user’s Instagram product photos, Roots enables shoppers to buy items featured in the images quickly and seamlessly on their website. 

Loblaw Digital: Lauren Steinberg, Marketing Director 
The Loblaw Digital team builds and operates the digital businesses in the Loblaws family of brands. Joe Fresh has scaled their online presence and produces a well curated blog featuring shopable product, lifestyle, and behind the scenes posts.
   
Sampler: Nitika Wahi, Special Projects 
Sampler, a local Toronto success story, makes it easy for companies to reach key customers with product samples. Their service encourages brands to empower those who already love the company to try products from another line or highlight a new call to action. Past partners include The Body Shop, Weleda, and Manitoba Harvest. 

Amanda Cosco, Fashion Tech Journalist (Moderator)
An entrepreneur and journalist focused on the intersection of fashion and technology, reporting on wearable technology, future fashion, and next-gen retail for the CBC, the Toronto Star, and the Globe and Mail. Founded Girl About Toronto, a blog-turned creative communications company specializing in content & coverage services for brands invested in local and lifestyle. 


Startup demos from:

InkBox
A Toronto startup that is revolutionizing the tattoo industry. Using fruit-based inks, Inkbox sells temporary tattoos that last for 2 weeks with a promise of no fading or peeling. Inkbox is also very socially minded. A percentage of all sales go towards supporting local indigenous communities in Panama, where their ink is from. 


Raw Finery Studio
An up and coming fashion co-working space, Raw Finery Studio is a hybrid fashion lab and community work studio that provides its members with event venues, multi-disciplinary studio space, and cutting edge equipment.

Daniel Christian Tang
Using 3D printers, Daniel Christian Tang creates jewelry designed using architectural modelling software and 3 dimensional digital manufacturing technology. There has yet to be a full line of 3D jewelry in the mass market of brick and mortar stores and this Toronto startup aspires to be one of the first.

As always, we'll begin and end the evening with networking.
results.how_to_find_us: 3rd Floor
results.name: TORONTO: Engagement Strategies for Brands

results.description:
Manhattan Toastmasters' General Meeting is scheduled for Thursday, September 24, 2015. We would like to welcome guests to attend this meeting. You will get to experience awesome speeches by our Manhattan Toastmasters Club members as well gain some experience speaking in front of a group. 

Our meetings are divided into three sections. The first section is project speeches, delivered by our Club Members. The second section is Table Topics, where Club Members and Guests get a chance to practice impromptu speaking. Third and final section are Evaluations when the project speakers receive constructive feedback from the evaluators. 

Come and join us for our General meeting and take the first step in improving your public speaking skills, gain confidence and make new friends who will support and encourage you.

AFTER-PARTY immediately after the meeting we will socialize at The Upstairs Pub located on the 2nd Floor of Everyday Gourmet Cafe (corner of 41st & Lexington)
results.name: Sept 24 - General Meeting

results.description:
CHANGE OF VENUE!!! Correct venue: 115 East 23rd Street (3rd Floor)

If you are an ebay seller, you probably have heard of Jason T. Smith. He runs a The Thrifting Board facebook group, is the co-host of a YouTube video series called Thrifty Business, a co-star of Spike TV's Thrift Hunters, an ebay "Influencer", and the proprietor of the Tiki Pug Music ebay store.  


Well, Jason will be joining our meetup group for a fun and informative few hours, courtesy of Worthpoint. Jason will share some tips, tricks and motivation to get us all on the right track as we approach Q4.

Will Seippel--an avid collector, successful seller, and founder of Worthpoint--will also join us to share some of his best tips to help us make as much profit as possible through accurate identification and valuation.

WorthPoint is the largest resource for identifying, researching and valuing antiques, art and vintage collectibles. Our suite of online and mobile offerings consists of a huge database for researching and valuing antiques, art and collectibles, a detailed catalog of Maker’s Marks and other identifying indicators, as well as access to a library of reference books and price guides from leading publishers in a wide range of antiques and collecting categories.


Refreshments will be served.

There will also be a drawing for cool prizes.

THERE IS A CAPACITY LIMIT OF 40 SO PLEASE RSVP & PAY IN ADVANCE TO ENSURE YOUR ENTRY.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow the signs or call/text 914-419-0671
results.name: Get motivated for Q4 with thrifting expert Jason T Smith & Worthpoint

results.description:
Hello,

We will cover the basics of electrical engineering and understand what Logic Gates are. We can use these gates to control input/output and you will learn how to do so. Marc BSEE/MSEE from Tufts will be teaching a 30 minute lecture follow by a DIY session.

The workshop costs $20, a lot cheaper than a lot of electronics classes. 

What does $20 include?

• 30 minute lecture on basic circuitry, binary numbers and logic gates. Get ready for a riddle.


• DIY Materials: 9V Battery, battery clips, jumper wires, breadboard, 7 segment display, 3 IC chips, DIP switches, resistors, capacitors, worksheets.
https://youtu.be/3EiUfMyOy-4

We normally go to a bar afterwards, feel free to join us! :)
results.name: Basic Circuits & Logic Gates

results.description:
FOR REGISTRATION AND DETAILS: http://womensprosperitynetwork.com/NYC

Treat yourself & join us for a time of Brilliance, Brainstorming & Breakthroughs. Mastermind with Extraordinary Women with WPN's Signature Formula that Creates Amazing Results! Make Lasting & Meaningful Connections That Move Your Business and Your Life Forward!


Mastermind Topic: The Key to Influential Conversations: Powerful Words for a Powerful Life

Whether you’re selling yourself on a new goal, selling your product or service to a prospect, or just trying to influence your kids to clean up their room, your communication can help or hinder the process. The words and phrases we say to ourselves and to others will direct our outcome. So doesn’t it make sense to use words that influence people in the right direction rather than the wrong one?

In this month’s mastermind experience, you'll have the opportunity to:

- Identify and create awareness of specific words and phrases that empower you and the people you’re influencing or selling.

- Recognize which words hit your 'hot buttons' and learn to disconnect the switch.

- Re-frame your thoughts and words for increased joy and connectivity with others.

Are You Ready?

Say YES to Having More!

Say YES to Having it Be Easy to Be Clear, Concise and Confident When Sharing Your Message!

Workshop will start promptly at 6:30pm! Please plan to arrive at 6:00pm for Registration and Networking.

Questions??? Call our Team WPN Global:[masked] or email [masked]

See You There!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
